analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni zhi ba'o //
translated: The equality of all phenomena is peace.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba'i nyi bar 'tshe ba dang bral bas na zhi ba nyid dam rnam par rtog pa'i dba' brlabs thams cad zhi ba'i don gyis ni zhi bo nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba'i nyi bar 'tshe ba dang bral bas na zhi ba nyid dam rnam par rtog pa'i dba' brlabs thams cad zhi ba'i don gyis ni zhi bo nyid do //
translated: It is peace because it is free from the torment of the sun of the afflictions. It is peace in the sense that all waves of conceptuality are pacified.

original: dge ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das @234a * //🔽pa bye brag pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i tshul ni mya ngan las 'das pas te de thob pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das @234a * // pa bye brag pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i tshul ni mya ngan las 'das pas te de thob pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the supreme good because it is the supreme good.🔽The mode of positing nirvana as the supreme good is like the mode of positing nirvana as the supreme good by the Vaisheshikas.

original: mar me shi ba dang mtshungs par nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mar me shi ba dang mtshungs par nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it is free from all harm, like the extinction of a lamp.

original: de'i legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Its excellence is nirvana.

original: de thos par byed pa'i lam ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de thos par byed pa'i lam ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The path that causes one to hear that is emancipation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang nye ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang nye ba'o //
translated: It is close to nirvana.

original: de yang 'dis nges par 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dis nges par 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is emancipation because it causes one to definitely emerge from samsara.

original: de ltar nges par 'byung bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byung bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as emancipation in that way.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag zad pa ni thar pa yin no zhes gcer bu pa rnams 'dod la /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag zad pa ni thar pa yin no zhes gcer bu pa rnams 'dod la /
translated: The Nirgranthas assert that liberation is the exhaustion of pleasure and pain.

original: de skyed pa'i las zad pas na zad pa la ni mthar gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de skyed pa'i las zad pas na zad pa la ni mthar gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the karma that produces it is exhausted, the exhaustion is called the “ultimate.”

original: gang gi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams mthar phyin par mdzad pa'i mthar byon pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams mthar phyin par mdzad pa'i mthar byon pas so //
translated: Because he is the one who has come to the ultimate of happiness and suffering.

original: yul thams cad la ji srid du rang bzhi gnyis chags pa dang bral bas na chags bral lo //
analyzed: yul thams cad la ji srid du rang bzhi gnyis chags pa dang bral bas na chags bral lo //
translated: He is free from attachment to all objects, since he is free from attachment to his own two.

original: rdzas thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su gyur pa la mi dben pa'i 'ching pa rnams zad pa'i skyes bu 'ba' zhig yin pas na lus las 'das pa po ste //
analyzed: rdzas thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su gyur pa la mi dben pa'i 'ching pa rnams zad pa'i skyes bu 'ba' zhig yin pas na lus las 'das pa po ste //
translated: He is the one who has transcended the body, since he is the only one who has exhausted the bonds of non-separation from the transformation of the nature of all substances.

original: yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyi skyes bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyi skyes bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is the one who is the nature of the completely pure bodhisattva.

original: gzhan rnams kyis brgal bar mi nus pas na thub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis brgal bar mi nus pas na thub pa med pa'o //
translated: He is the one who cannot be refuted by others.

original: gnyis pa med pas na dpe med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pas na dpe med pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is without example, since he is without a second.

original: mngon par gsal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa mnga' bas na mi mngon pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa mnga' bas na mi mngon pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is not manifest, since he possesses manifest form and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad bral ba ste mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad bral ba ste mi snang ba'o //
translated: He is the one who is free from all aspects, since he is not manifest.

original: rnam pa gang gis kyang rtsir mi nus pas na gsal byed min no //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kyang rtsir mi nus pas na gsal byed min no //
translated: It is not a manifestor, because it cannot be measured by any form.

original: cha thams cad las yang dag par 'das pas //
analyzed: cha thams cad las yang dag par 'das pas //
translated: It is all-pervading, because it transcends all parts.

original: lus med bzhin du brten pas nu kun 'gro'o //
analyzed: lus med bzhin du brten pas nu kun 'gro'o //
translated: It is omnipresent, because it is supported without having a body.

original: nus pa'i tshul gyis thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pas na khyab pa po'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i tshul gyis thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pas na khyab pa po'o //
translated: It is the pervader, because it accomplishes everything by the mode of capability.

original: rnal 'byor ba ma yin pa rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas na phra ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba ma yin pa rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas na phra ba'o //
translated: It is subtle, because it cannot be known by those who are not yogis.

original: shin tu rnam par dag par gur pas na zag med do //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag par gur pas na zag med do //
translated: It is undefiled, because it is completely pure.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rgya ma yin pas nas ban bral lo //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rgya ma yin pas nas ban bral lo //
translated: It is free from substantiality, because it is not the seal of all things.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'i grol ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su bcom ldan 'das rje btsun 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'i grol ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su bcom ldan 'das rje btsun 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the Blessed One, the Venerable Manjusri, explained as the form of liberation, etc., of other philosophical systems?

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid ni gro ba 'dod pa thams cad kyis bstan par bya ba yin gyi de las gzhan med do zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid ni gro ba 'dod pa thams cad kyis bstan par bya ba yin gyi de las gzhan med do zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained in that way in order to teach that the Blessed One himself is to be taught by all those who desire liberation, and that there is no one else.

original: yang na gdul bya de dang de la de dang de de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba la gzhol bar mdzad pas na de'i ming btags @234b pa yin pa thams cad la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang na gdul bya de dang de la de dang de de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba la gzhol bar mdzad pas na de'i ming btags @234b pa yin pa thams cad la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Or else, it is the case that all of them are named after the form in which they are engaged in the conversion of this or that disciple.🔽In order to demonstrate the qualities of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body, he says,🔽He is free from dust, free from dross, stainless,

original: chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku'i yon tan bstan par bya'i phyir rdul med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku'i yon tan bstan par bya'i phyir rdul med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: free from evil, free from the kleśas,🔽free from thoughts, free from conceptual differentiation,🔽free from the appearance of discursive representations.

original: phyi rol gyi yul rnams la zhen pa'i 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral bas na rdul med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul rnams la zhen pa'i 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral bas na rdul med pa'o //
translated: He is free from dust because he is free from the dust of desire which is attachment to external objects.

original: sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rdul sna tshogs pa dang bral bas na rdul bral lo //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rdul sna tshogs pa dang bral bas na rdul bral lo //
translated: He is free from dross because he is free from the dross of the various conceptual thoughts of the mind.

original: bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa sna tshogs pa dang bral bas na dri ma med pa'i //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa sna tshogs pa dang bral bas na dri ma med pa'i //
translated: He is stainless because he is free from the various latent impressions and envelopments.

original: phyi dang nang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyi nyes pa spangs pas na nyes pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyi nyes pa spangs pas na nyes pa spangs pa'o //
translated: He is free from evil because he has eliminated the faults of the latent impressions of the negative instinct for the internal and external discursive thought processes.

original: nang du gyur pa'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang bral bas na skyon mad pa'o //
analyzed: nang du gyur pa'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang bral bas na skyon mad pa'o //
translated: It is free from the connection of the latent impressions of the clinging to the internal self and what belongs to the self, and so it is faultless.

original: yang na snga ma ma'i bshad par gyur pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i rnam grangs nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: yang na snga ma ma'i bshad par gyur pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i rnam grangs nyid yin pa'am /
translated: Or else, the former is the synonym of the latter.

original: sgra 'di dag ni chos kyi sku ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra 'di dag ni chos kyi sku ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: These words indicate the Dharma Body.

original: tshig la la la tshig gzhan la la dag gis don rtogs par 'gyur bas rnam grangs su bstan pa nyid dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig la la la tshig gzhan la la dag gis don rtogs par 'gyur bas rnam grangs su bstan pa nyid dgos pa yin no //
translated: Since one understands the meaning through some words with other words, the teaching by way of synonyms is the purpose.

original: yang na tshig lngas mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga ston pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshig lngas mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga ston pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the five words indicate the five aspects of manifest enlightenment.

original: aom tsi tta pra ti bo dhyam ka ro mi zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par byed pa'i sems tsam so sor rtogs pas na rdul med do //
analyzed: aom tsi tta pra ti bo dhyam ka ro mi zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par byed pa'i sems tsam so sor rtogs pas na rdul med do //
translated: Om, I generate the mind of enlightenment. Since one realizes the mind only, which is the subject and object, it is stainless.

original: aom bo dhi tsittam autp'a da y'a mi zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i 'od zer zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs rnam par snang ba bzhin du 'byung bas mdzes pa na rdul bral lo //
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsittam autp'a da y'a mi zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i 'od zer zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs rnam par snang ba bzhin du 'byung bas mdzes pa na rdul bral lo //
translated: The mantra Om bodhicittam utpadayāmi means I generate the thought of enlightenment, and since it arises in the form of a stainless light, a moon-disk, it is stainless.

original: aom tishtha badzra badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs kyis mu stegs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dregs pa 'joms pas dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: aom tishtha badzra badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs kyis mu stegs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dregs pa 'joms pas dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The mantra Om tiṣṭha vajra, āṭṭa, haṃ means Stand, O vajra, stand, and since it destroys the pride of the various tīrthikas in the form of a five-pronged vajra on the moon-disk, it is stainless.

original: aom sa manta bha dro& ham zhes bya ba thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i kun du bzang po'i gzugs kyis mun nag thams cad rnam par bsal bas na nyes pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: aom sa manta bha dro& ham zhes bya ba thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i kun du bzang po'i gzugs kyis mun nag thams cad rnam par bsal bas na nyes pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The mantra Om samanta bhadra ho means I am all-good, and since it dispels all darkness in the form of all-goodness, it is faultless.

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ta th'a aa ham zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid dngos po dang mnyam pas 'khor ba thams cad pa'i nyes pa'i nad dang bral bas na skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ta th'a aa ham zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid dngos po dang mnyam pas 'khor ba thams cad pa'i nyes pa'i nad dang bral bas na skyon med pa'o //
translated: Om, ya tha, all tathagatas, tatha, aham means I am the nature of all tathagatas, and since it is equal to all things, it is faultless because it is free from the disease of the faults of all cyclic existences.

original: dang bo bshad pa'i phyogs chos kyi sku ltar ma lus pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa'i chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na shin tu sad pa'o //
analyzed: dang bo bshad pa'i phyogs chos kyi sku ltar ma lus pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa'i chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na shin tu sad pa'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the realization of all phenomena without exception to the end of the summit of existence, it is fully awakened like the dharma body.

original: gdul bya'i sems can sna tshogs pa'i sems kyi rgyud thugs su chud pas na sad pa'i bdag go //🔽dge slong dag chos thams cad ces bya ba ni nye @235a * //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems can sna tshogs pa'i sems kyi rgyud thugs su chud pas na sad pa'i bdag go // dge slong dag chos thams cad ces bya ba ni nye @235a * //
translated: Since it is the realization of the mind-streams of various disciples, it is the lord of the awakened ones.

original: bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pa de mkhyen pa'i phyir kun shes pa'am nyam thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la de lta bu'i nan tan nyams su len pa bskyed par mdzad pas na kun shes pa ste /
analyzed: bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pa de mkhyen pa'i phyir kun shes pa'am nyam thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la de lta bu'i nan tan nyams su len pa bskyed par mdzad pas na kun shes pa ste /
translated: Bhikshus, all phenomena are called the five appropriated aggregates. Since he knows that, he is omniscient, and since he causes the practice of such earnest practice in sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, he is the lord of the omniscient ones.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is endowed with the gnosis of omniscience.

original: nyam thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las mchog tu gyur cing de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i spyod yul mnga' bas kun rig dam pa'o //
analyzed: nyam thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las mchog tu gyur cing de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i spyod yul mnga' bas kun rig dam pa'o //
translated: He is the highest of all sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and is the supreme knower, since he possesses the domain of the individual knowledge of the Tathagata, Bodhisattvas, and so forth.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen na rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po yod na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sku yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen na rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po yod na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sku yin zhe na /
translated: If he is omniscient, how can he be the Dharma Body, which is completely pure in all aspects, when there is something to be known and a knower?

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
translated: The Dharma Body is beyond the reality of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te byed pa po dang / las dang bya ba la sogs par brtags pa'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos por gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don dam par med pas rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te byed pa po dang / las dang bya ba la sogs par brtags pa'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos por gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don dam par med pas rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Since the consciousness that is the object and subject of phenomena, imagined as an agent, object, action, and so forth, does not exist ultimately, the Dharma Body is beyond the reality of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos dang phral na ni rnam pa thams cad du bems por 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos dang phral na ni rnam pa thams cad du bems por 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To refute that idea, it is said:

original: ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba //
translated: The body of nondual wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gnyis su med pa'i tshul de'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su 'chang ba'i ye shes yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gnyis su med pa'i tshul de'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su 'chang ba'i ye shes yin gyi /
translated: It is the wisdom that completely holds the nature of that nondual way.

original: shes pa dang shes par byed pa po'i tshul can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes par byed pa po'i tshul can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the way of knower and known.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad du mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med do //🔽shes pa dang shes par byed pa dad /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad du mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med do // shes pa dang shes par byed pa dad /
translated: In that case, it is completely nonexistent, like the son of a barren woman.

original: khod du chud pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs la spyod pa las gzhan pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi skus sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba byed par ji ltar nus she na /
analyzed: khod du chud pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs la spyod pa las gzhan pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi skus sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba byed par ji ltar nus she na /
translated: How can the body of nondual wisdom, which is different from the multitude of conceptual thoughts that are the knower and the known, the understood and the understanding, perform the function of benefiting all sentient beings?

original: 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here is the explanation.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin la sangs rgyas rnams dbang bskyur bas yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad kyi rnam par
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin la sangs rgyas rnams dbang bskyur bas yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad kyi rnam par
translated: The buddhas are empowered in the nature of nonconceptual gnosis, the nondual essence of the dharmadhatu, and like wish-fulfilling gems, they fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: rtog pa'i tshogs la spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i tshogs la spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not act in the manner of conceptual collections.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rnam par rtog med lhun gyis grub //🔽ces bya'o // dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med lhun gyis grub // ces bya'o // dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa //
translated: it is said that they are nonconceptual and spontaneous.

original: zhes bya ba la ji ltar gcig pus dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi bya ba mdzad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji ltar gcig pus dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi bya ba mdzad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: As for the line “They act for the buddhas of the three times,” one might ask, “How is it that they act for the buddhas of the three times?”

original: de brjod par bya ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung @235b yang rung /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung @235b yang rung /
translated: This is explained as follows.🔽Whether or not the tathagatas have appeared,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether or not the tathagatas have appeared,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di na gnas pa ste /
translated: the nature of phenomena remains.

original: chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas gcig pu nyid kyis kyang dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi bya ba mdzad pa yin no //🔽yang na / tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas gcig pu nyid kyis kyang dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi bya ba mdzad pa yin no // yang na / tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
translated: Again, all buddhas are equal in terms of the Dharma body, the assembly of disciples, and the performance of benefit for transmigrating beings.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //🔽sku tshe rigs dang tshad kyis min //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste // sku tshe rigs dang tshad kyis min //
translated: All buddhas are equal in terms of the Dharma body, the assembly of disciples, and the performance of benefit for transmigrating beings.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chos kyi sku la khyad par med pas gcig pu nyid kyis dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chos kyi sku la khyad par med pas gcig pu nyid kyis dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference in the Dharma body, all buddhas of the three times perform the activities of buddhas as one.

original: de dag nyid bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: de dag nyid bstan pa ni ;
translated: The same point is taught:

original: sangs rgyas thog ma tham med //🔽ces bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thog ma tham med // ces bya ste /
translated: Buddhas have no beginning or end.

original: thog ma dang tha ma ni thog ma dang tha ma'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma ni thog ma dang tha ma'o //
translated: The beginning and end are the beginning and end.

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
translated: That which has no beginning and end is beginningless and endless.

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: That is the Dharma body.

original: de nyid ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: That is the ultimate Buddha.

original: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: Those who see me in form,

original: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
analyzed: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
translated: And those who follow me in sound,

original: log pas spong par zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: log pas spong par zhugs pa ste //
translated: Have entered the wrong path;

original: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
translated: Those people do not see me.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid ltar //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid ltar //
translated: The Buddhas are to be seen🔽In terms of the reality body.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The leaders are the reality body.

original: zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,

original: thog ma nyid chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pas na dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: thog ma nyid chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pas na dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the primordial Buddha because he is the reality body from the very beginning.

original: gang las kyang skye ba med pas na rgyu med pa ste /
analyzed: gang las kyang skye ba med pas na rgyu med pa ste /
translated: He is causeless because he is not born from anything.

original: rgyu ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / so sor 'brel pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / so sor 'brel pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: A cause is a cause of the same kind, a cause of possession, and a cause of continuity.

original: ye shes nyid gcig pu gnyis su med pa ni mig dang 'dra bas na mig ste /
analyzed: ye shes nyid gcig pu gnyis su med pa ni mig dang 'dra bas na mig ste /
translated: The reality body is the eye because it is the unique, nondual eye.

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de la //
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de la //
translated: The reality body is

original: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
analyzed: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
translated: The one eye of wisdom is stainless.

original: ces bya'o // 'dir chos thams cad rgyal zhing de'i bdag nyid du thim par 'gyur bas na ye shes lus can no //
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'dir chos thams cad rgyal zhing de'i bdag nyid du thim par 'gyur bas na ye shes lus can no //
translated: Here, embodiment of pristine awareness means that all phenomena are conquered and dissolve into that nature.

original: de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Thus-gone means that he has gone to suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can du bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can du bshad zin to //
translated: The Bhagavān has been explained as having the nature of the dharmakāya.

original: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lngar bshad pa'i phyogs ltar na rab tu sad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis na shin tu sad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lngar bshad pa'i phyogs ltar na rab tu sad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis na shin tu sad pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of the explanation of the fivefold manifest enlightenment, fully awakened is in the manner of Vairocana of the awakened family.

original: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na sad pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na sad pa'i bdag go //
translated: Awakened being is by the nature of Akṣobhya.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na kun shes pa'o //
translated: Omniscient is by the nature of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na kun rig go //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na kun rig go //
translated: All-knowing is by the nature of Amitābha.

original: don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na dam pa'o //
analyzed: don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na dam pa'o //
translated: Sublime is by the nature of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de ltar mngon par byang @236a * //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par byang @236a * //
translated: Thus, the fivefold manifest enlightenment is complete.

original: chub pa rnam pa lnga yongs su rdzogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chub pa rnam pa lnga yongs su rdzogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'o //
translated: The nature of consciousness, which is the identity of the five thus-gone ones, who are the perfect completion of the five awakenings, is beyond the reality of consciousness.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin can thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshul dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin can thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshul dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since it is endowed with the mode of being in union with the nondual method and wisdom, which is the nature of gnosis,

original: ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba //
translated: it is the holder of the mode of nondual gnosis.

original: rnam par rtog pa med cing lhun gyis grub par dus gsum gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'phro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi phrin las mdzad pas na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med cing lhun gyis grub par dus gsum gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'phro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi phrin las mdzad pas na /
translated: Since it performs the activity of emanating the perfect buddhas of the three times, which is its identity, without conceptuality and spontaneously present,

original: rnam par rtog med lhun gyis grub //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med lhun gyis grub //
translated: it is the spontaneous presence without conceptuality.

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa //
translated: It is the agent of the buddhas of the three times.

original: zhes bya'o // thog mtha' med pa'i sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // thog mtha' med pa'i sems dpa' ni //
translated: The hero without beginning or end

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dga' ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dga' ba che //
translated: is Vajrasattva, great joy.

original: zhes bshad pas na sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas na sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: Thus, since the Buddha is the essence of the mind of enlightenment, the vajra holder, he is the primordial Buddha.

original: de nyid ni thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas na rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas na rgyu'o //
translated: Since he is the cause of all, he is the cause.

original: de'i rgyu ni gzhan med pas na rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni gzhan med pas na rgyu med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no other cause than him, he is causeless.

original: ye shes kyi mig gcig ni spyan lnga'i bya ba rdzogs par byed pas na /
analyzed: ye shes kyi mig gcig ni spyan lnga'i bya ba rdzogs par byed pas na /
translated: The single eye of pristine awareness is the one eye of pristine awareness that accomplishes the function of the five eyes.

original: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
analyzed: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
translated: It is the single eye of pristine awareness, stainless.

original: ces bya'o // ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: ces bya'o // ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The body of pristine awareness is the Tathāgata.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i dbang du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i dbang du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since he has gone to the state of the Tathāgata, he is the Tathāgata.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that he is the essence of the body of perfect enjoyment,

original: tshig gi dbang phyug smra ba che //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshig gi dbang phyug smra ba che //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he is the lord of speech, the great speaker.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang thun mong du gyur pa'i zab cing rgya che ba'i chos ston pa la mnga' brnyes pas na gsung la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir tshig gi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang thun mong du gyur pa'i zab cing rgya che ba'i chos ston pa la mnga' brnyes pas na gsung la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir tshig gi dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord of speech because he has mastered speech, since he has attained mastery in teaching the profound and extensive Dharma in common with the bodhisattvas who are lords of the tenth stage.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni chen po ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni chen po ste /
translated: The gnosis of omniscience is great

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te //
translated: because it is the essence of the realization of all aspects of all things.

original: de gsungs pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni smra ba che zhes bya ba'am smra ba'i yul chen po mnga' bas na smra ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni smra ba che zhes bya ba'am smra ba'i yul chen po mnga' bas na smra ba chen po ste /
translated: He who possesses that speech is called the great speaker or the one with the great domain of speech.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams las chen por gyur pa yin zhing lhag par gyur pas thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i gsung dang ldan pas na smra ba chen po'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams las chen por gyur pa yin zhing lhag par gyur pas thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i gsung dang ldan pas na smra ba chen po'o //
translated: He is the great speaker because he is greater than the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on, because he is superior, and because he possesses speech that overwhelms them all.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i mu stegs byed skyes bur smra bar 'dod pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pas na smra ba'i skyes mchog go //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i mu stegs byed skyes bur smra bar 'dod pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pas na smra ba'i skyes mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme speaker because he is the chief of those who assert that the creator is a person, other than the Sravakas, etc.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @236b dpa' dang / phur bu dang / drag po dang / dbang po dang / khyab 'jug dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa'i smra ba'i tshogs rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i gsung gis shin tu mdzes pas na smra ba'i rgyal lo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @236b dpa' dang / phur bu dang / drag po dang / dbang po dang / khyab 'jug dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa'i smra ba'i tshogs rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i gsung gis shin tu mdzes pas na smra ba'i rgyal lo //
translated: He is the king of speakers because he is very beautiful with a voice that overwhelms the hosts of speakers, such as the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, Bodhisattvas, Skanda, Rudra, Ishvara, Vishnu, Brahma, etc.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / rgyal ba'i sras dang / changs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi smra ba'i mchog yin zhing phyin ci ma log pa dang / mi slu ba'i rnam pa thams cad du tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don ston pas na smra ba'i dam pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / rgyal ba'i sras dang / changs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi smra ba'i mchog yin zhing phyin ci ma log pa dang / mi slu ba'i rnam pa thams cad du tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don ston pas na smra ba'i dam pa'o //
translated: He is the best of speakers because he is the best of the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, Bodhisattvas, Brahma, etc., and because he teaches the meaning that is endowed with all the aspects of valid knowledge, which is unmistaken and non-deceptive.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: mchog gi gnas te /
analyzed: mchog gi gnas te /
translated: he is the supreme abode.

original: khyad par du smra ba po thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du smra ba po thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the supreme of all speakers.

original: bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa thams cad kyis thub par mi nus pas na /
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa thams cad kyis thub par mi nus pas na /
translated: He is not overcome by any demons, extremists, etc.

original: smra ba'i seng ge tshugs pa med //
analyzed: smra ba'i seng ge tshugs pa med //
translated: Thus, he is the fearless lion of speakers.

original: ces bya'o // gsung gi 'byor pas thams cad zil gyis gnon par spyod pa'i thun mong ma yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // gsung gi 'byor pas thams cad zil gyis gnon par spyod pa'i thun mong ma yin pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the uncommon conduct of overcoming all by the excellence of his speech,

original: sku'i bdag nyid che ba'i thun mong ma yin pa'i tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sku'i bdag nyid che ba'i thun mong ma yin pa'i tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the uncommon way of the greatness of his body,🔽he said,

original: kun du blta ba mchog tu dga' //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du blta ba mchog tu dga' // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is the all-seeing one, the supremely joyful.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyis nam mkha'i mthas gtug sa pa na spyod pa'i dngos po ma lus pa rnam pa thams cad du ma lus par gzigs pa'i dang tshul mnga' bas na kun du blta ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyis nam mkha'i mthas gtug sa pa na spyod pa'i dngos po ma lus pa rnam pa thams cad du ma lus par gzigs pa'i dang tshul mnga' bas na kun du blta ba'o //
translated: He has the way of seeing all things without exception, in all their aspects, with unobstructed pristine wisdom, reaching to the ends of space.

original: chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i rab tu dga' ba'i sku'i bde ba chen pos 'phags pa mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa'i rab tu dga' ba'i sku'i bde ba chen pos 'phags pa mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The supreme joy of the sublime ones is the great bliss of the body of the first ground, which is the realization of the thatness of phenomena.

original: 'od zer 'phro ba'i phreng bas brgyan pa'i sku mnga' bas na gzi brjid phreng ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'phro ba'i phreng bas brgyan pa'i sku mnga' bas na gzi brjid phreng ba'o //
translated: The body adorned with a garland of radiating light rays is the garland of splendor.

original: gzi brjid kyi phreng bas bskor na yang zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang ldan pas legs par snang ba'i phyir blta na sdug pa'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid kyi phreng bas bskor na yang zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang ldan pas legs par snang ba'i phyir blta na sdug pa'o //
translated: Even though surrounded by a garland of splendor, the body has the nature of peace, and is therefore beautiful to behold.

original: mi shes pa'i mun nag sel bar byed pa'i ye shes dam pa'i 'od mchog mnga' bas na 'od bzang ngo //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mun nag sel bar byed pa'i ye shes dam pa'i 'od mchog mnga' bas na 'od bzang ngo //
translated: The supreme light of sublime wisdom that dispels the darkness of ignorance is the good light.

original: ye shes kyi gzugs kyis shes bya rnams la khyab cing gsal bar mdzad pas na 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi gzugs kyis shes bya rnams la khyab cing gsal bar mdzad pas na 'bar ba'o //
translated: The wisdom form that pervades and illuminates all objects of knowledge is the blazing.

original: dpal be'u'i dpe byad kyis brgyan pa'i dpal gyi tshogs dang ldan pas na dpal gyi be'u'o //
analyzed: dpal be'u'i dpe byad kyis brgyan pa'i dpal gyi tshogs dang ldan pas na dpal gyi be'u'o //
translated: The collection of splendor adorned with the auspicious sign of the endless knot is the auspicious knot.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mdangs dang ldan pas mdzes par gyur cing gsal bar snang ba rang gis rtogs pas nang gi de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i snang ba gang la yod pa de ni //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mdangs dang ldan pas mdzes par gyur cing gsal bar snang ba rang gis rtogs pas nang gi de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i snang ba gang la yod pa de ni //
translated: He is beautiful, shining with radiance in every way, and he is the light that illuminates the inner reality, which is realized by oneself.

original: lag na 'od 'bar snang ba po //
analyzed: lag na 'od 'bar snang ba po //
translated: He is the light that shines with rays in his hands.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This is what it means.

original: 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i gzi brjid can zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽yang na 'od zer rnams kyis snang bar byas @237a * //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i gzi brjid can zhes bya ba'i don to // yang na 'od zer rnams kyis snang bar byas @237a * //
translated: He has the splendor that overwhelms the entire retinue.

original: pa'i ngang tshul ni snang ba bo'o //
analyzed: pa'i ngang tshul ni snang ba bo'o //
translated: Or else, the state of being illuminated by the rays is light.

original: ka ni bde ba /
analyzed: ka ni bde ba /
translated: Ka is bliss.

original: ra ni ster ba ste /
analyzed: ra ni ster ba ste /
translated: Ra is giving.

original: de bas bde ba ster ba'i phyir lag na ka ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas bde ba ster ba'i phyir lag na ka ra zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because he gives bliss, he is called “having a karaka in his hand.”

original: de ltar na bde ba ster ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba ster ba yang yin la /
translated: Thus, he is the one who gives bliss,

original: 'od 'bar snang ba bo yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'od 'bar snang ba bo yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: and he is the light that shines with rays.🔽The one who gives bliss in this way is the nature of light that dispels such ignorance.

original: de lta bu'i ma rig pa sel bar byed pa'i bde ba ster bar byed pa'i snang ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rang nyid yin pas rje btsun 'jam dpal la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ma rig pa sel bar byed pa'i bde ba ster bar byed pa'i snang ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rang nyid yin pas rje btsun 'jam dpal la /
translated: The one who is the nature of light that dispels such ignorance is the🔽master Mañjuśrī himself.

original: bde sbyin 'od 'bar snang ba po //
analyzed: bde sbyin 'od 'bar snang ba po //
translated: The Illuminator, the radiant light of bliss.

original: zhes bya'o // de rnams rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i mtshan rnams dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de rnams rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i mtshan rnams dang ldan zhing /
translated: Thus, endowed with the major marks, which are the best of all aspects,

original: dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni nyid kyi don yongs su rdzogs par bstan nas /
analyzed: dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni nyid kyi don yongs su rdzogs par bstan nas /
translated: and adorned with the minor marks, he is the essence of the Sambhogakaya, which is the perfect fulfillment of one's own aim.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdze btsun 'jam dpal gyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i thabs kyi tshul nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdze btsun 'jam dpal gyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i thabs kyi tshul nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the very method by which the Blessed One, the Noble Manjusri, accomplishes the aims of others,

original: sman pa che mchog gco bo ste //
analyzed: sman pa che mchog gco bo ste //
translated: The great physician, the supreme healer,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: nad thams cad rnam par zlog par byed pa bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis ston par mdzad pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi sman stsol zhing nyon mongs pa'i nad rnams gso par mdzad pas na sman pa che mchog go //
analyzed: nad thams cad rnam par zlog par byed pa bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis ston par mdzad pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi sman stsol zhing nyon mongs pa'i nad rnams gso par mdzad pas na sman pa che mchog go //
translated: He is the great physician because he bestows the medicine of the holy Dharma, which teaches the two kinds of selflessness, and heals the disease of the afflictions, which completely turns away from all diseases.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can gyi nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi gzhi'i khyad par ston par mdzad pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can gyi nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi gzhi'i khyad par ston par mdzad pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: It is the chief because it shows the special basis of the disease of the defilements, whose root is the false imagination of the self and what belongs to the self.

original: thog ma med pa'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: It is the best of all medicines because it cures the disease of the defilements, which has been transmitted from one existence to another without beginning.

original: zug pa'i zug rdu'i gzugs can 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zug rdu rtsa ba nas 'byin pas na /🔽zug rdu 'byin pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: zug pa'i zug rdu'i gzugs can 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zug rdu rtsa ba nas 'byin pas na / zug rdu 'byin pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the best of all extractors of darts because it extracts from the root the darts of the defilements, such as desire, which are like the darts of a charnel ground.

original: sman rnams ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyar zhing bsgrub pas nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus pa zhi bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sman rnams ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyar zhing bsgrub pas nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus pa zhi bar mdzad pas na /
translated: It is the best of all medicines because it cures all diseases of the defilements by applying and producing the nature of all medicines, the qualities of the Buddha.

original: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
analyzed: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
translated: It is the best of all trees because it is the tree of the Dharma, which is the best of all medicines.

original: zhes bya'o // nyon mongs pa rnams nyid gsod pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na nad do cog go //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // nyon mongs pa rnams nyid gsod pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na nad do cog go //
translated: The defilements are diseases because they are by nature killers.

original: de rnams kyi dgra ni dgra bo ltar rigs rgyud du bcas pa zad par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dgra ni dgra bo ltar rigs rgyud du bcas pa zad par mdzad pas na /
translated: It is the best of all enemies of disease because it destroys the lineage of all diseases, as if they were enemies.

original: nad do cog gi dgra che ba'o //
analyzed: nad do cog gi dgra che ba'o //
translated: It is the best of all enemies of disease.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dgrar gyur du zin kyang mi mthun pa'i gzugs ni nam yang mi mnga'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dgrar gyur du zin kyang mi mthun pa'i gzugs ni nam yang mi mnga'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:🔽Beautiful, supreme of the three worlds,

original: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum gyi mchog / dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum gyi mchog / dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: glorious, having a mandala of stars.

original: thams cad kyis 'dod par bya ba yin pas na sdu gu'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'dod par bya ba yin pas na sdu gu'o //
translated: Since it is desired by all, it is beautiful.

original: khams gsum gyi mchog tu gyur pas na /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi mchog tu gyur pas na /
translated: Since it is supreme in the three realms,

original: @237b 'jig rten gsum gyi mchog go //
analyzed: @237b 'jig rten gsum gyi mchog go //
translated: it is supreme of the three worlds.

original: skar ma rnams kyi nang na /
analyzed: skar ma rnams kyi nang na /
translated: Among the stars,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bar lha la sogs pa rnams kyi nang na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du yid 'phrog pa'i sku mnga' bas na /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bar lha la sogs pa rnams kyi nang na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du yid 'phrog pa'i sku mnga' bas na /
translated: like the mandala of the moon, it has a captivating body among gods and so forth, like the mandala of the moon.

original: dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can no //
analyzed: dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can no //
translated: Therefore, it is glorious, having a mandala of stars.

original: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i khams mthas gtugs pa rnams su chos kyi spyin pa'i ba dan bsgrengs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i don chen po 'dzugs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i khams mthas gtugs pa rnams su chos kyi spyin pa'i ba dan bsgrengs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i don chen po 'dzugs par mdzad pas na /
translated: Since it raises the great meaning, which is illustrated by raising the banner of the gift of Dharma to the ends of the realms of space in the ten directions,🔽it is said:

original: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i mthar thug par //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i mthar thug par //
translated: He has well planted the victory banner of Dharma

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs //
translated: in the ends of the ten directions.

original: zhes bya'o // char bab pa dang tsha ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba zlog par byed pa'i phyir dang / yongs su dub pa'i nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i grib ma byed pa'i phyir /🔽gdugs dang 'dra bas na gdugs te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // char bab pa dang tsha ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba zlog par byed pa'i phyir dang / yongs su dub pa'i nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i grib ma byed pa'i phyir / gdugs dang 'dra bas na gdugs te /
translated: He is like an umbrella, because he wards off the harm of rain and heat, and because he creates the shade that soothes the fatigue of the afflictions.

original: 'gro ba thams cad khyab par byed pa'i grib ma byed cing sdug bsngal gyi char dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sel bas na 'gro na gdugs gcig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad khyab par byed pa'i grib ma byed cing sdug bsngal gyi char dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sel bas na 'gro na gdugs gcig go //
translated: He is the sole umbrella for the world, because he creates the shade that pervades the entire world and because he removes the rain of suffering and the heat of the afflictions.

original: 'gro ba rnams khyab par byed pa'i gdugs gcig gi bdag nyid can yin zhing /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams khyab par byed pa'i gdugs gcig gi bdag nyid can yin zhing /
translated: He is the sole umbrella for the world, because he is the one who pervades the world.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dag gis kun nas 'khor ba'i tshul gyis 'gebs pas na /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dag gis kun nas 'khor ba'i tshul gyis 'gebs pas na /
translated: He is the sole vast umbrella for the world, because he covers it with his loving kindness and compassion.

original: 'gro na gdugs gcig yangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro na gdugs gcig yangs pa ste /
translated: He is the sole vast umbrella for the world,

original: byams dang snying rje'i dkyil 'khor can //
analyzed: byams dang snying rje'i dkyil 'khor can //
translated: because he is the one who has the sphere of loving kindness and compassion.

original: zhes bya'o // 'dam na gnas kyang dri mas ma gos pa'i phyir padma dang 'dra ste /🔽'khor ba'i 'dam du gnas pa'i nyes pas ma gos par gdul bya ji ltar 'dul ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i cha lugs dang / rgyan dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa'i gar stabs la dgyes shing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'dam na gnas kyang dri mas ma gos pa'i phyir padma dang 'dra ste / 'khor ba'i 'dam du gnas pa'i nyes pas ma gos par gdul bya ji ltar 'dul ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i cha lugs dang / rgyan dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa'i gar stabs la dgyes shing /
translated: Thus.

original: zhal dang / tshems dang / spyan dang / smin ma gnyer ba sna tshogs pa dang / phyag gi rtse mo dang zhabs rnam par rol pas sgeg pa'i thabs kyis gar mdzad par ston cing //
analyzed: zhal dang / tshems dang / spyan dang / smin ma gnyer ba sna tshogs pa dang / phyag gi rtse mo dang zhabs rnam par rol pas sgeg pa'i thabs kyis gar mdzad par ston cing //
translated: Like a lotus, he is not soiled by the faults of dwelling in the swamp of cyclic existence, and he delights in the dance of various facial expressions, teeth, eyes, and eyebrows, as well as in the dance of the play of the tips of his hands and feet, in order to tame disciples in whatever way is necessary, with whatever attire, ornaments, and graceful movements are appropriate.🔽He is the lord of the glorious dance of the lotus,

original: sems can ma lus pa 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa 'dul bar mdzad pas na /
translated: because he tames all sentient beings without exception.

original: dpal ldan padma gar gyi bdag / ces bya'o //🔽'byor pa dang / 'od kyis snang bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽dga' ba rgyas par byed pas na rin po che ste /
analyzed: dpal ldan padma gar gyi bdag / ces bya'o // 'byor pa dang / 'od kyis snang bar bya ba'i phyir / dga' ba rgyas par byed pas na rin po che ste /
translated: He is the great lord of the precious parasol,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi gdugs gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi gdugs gang yin pa de ni /
translated: because he is the parasol of the precious Three Jewels, which is the ornament of the world.

original: khyab bdag chen po rin chen gdugs //
analyzed: khyab bdag chen po rin chen gdugs //
translated: He is the great lord of the precious parasol,🔽because he is the parasol of the precious Three Jewels, which is the ornament of the world.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus,

original: thams cad kyi bdag po rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag po rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro // sangs rgyas kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas na /
translated: because he is the nature of Ratnasaṃbhava, the lord of all.🔽He is a buddha and all,

original: sangs rgyas kun te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de rnams kyi dbus su rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i tshul gyis @238a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o // de rnams kyi dbus su rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i tshul gyis @238a * //
translated: thus he is all buddhas, Akṣobhya and so forth.🔽In the middle of those,

original: mdzes pas na /
analyzed: mdzes pas na /
translated: he is beautiful by the method of Great Vairocana.🔽Thus,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rgyal po che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rgyal po che //
translated: he is the great king of all buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
translated: By the nature of Amoghasiddhi, he accomplishes the deeds of all buddhas.🔽Thus,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku 'chang ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku 'chang ba //
translated: he holds the body of all buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // rnal 'byor chen po skye gnas che //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rnal 'byor chen po skye gnas che //
translated: He is the great yoga, the great birth,

original: sangs rgyas kun gnas mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gnas mi zad pa'o //
translated: the abode of all buddhas, the imperishable.

original: zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he abides by the nature of Akṣobhya,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rnal 'byor che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rnal 'byor che //
translated: he is the great yoga of all buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // yang na dkyil 'khor pa'i lha thams cad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yang na dkyil 'khor pa'i lha thams cad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba ni //
translated: Or else, the yoga of the union of all the deities of the maṇḍala

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rnal 'byor che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rnal 'byor che //
translated: is the great yoga of all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa khro bo'i gzugs kyi dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa ma rungs pa thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pas na bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa khro bo'i gzugs kyi dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa ma rungs pa thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pas na bstan pa ste /
translated: The great lord Śiva and so forth, in the form of wrathful ones such as Vajrahūṃkāra, are all tamed, and thus it is the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa gcig gi tshul gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa gcig gi tshul gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The one way of the teaching of all buddhas is

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bstan pa gcig / ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bstan pa gcig / ces bya'o //
translated: the one teaching of all buddhas.

original: rdo rjes mchan pa'i rin po che ni rdo rje rin chen no //
analyzed: rdo rjes mchan pa'i rin po che ni rdo rje rin chen no //
translated: The vajra jewel is the vajra gem.

original: des dbang bskur bas khams gsum gyi bdag por dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpal gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: des dbang bskur bas khams gsum gyi bdag por dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dpal gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The glory characterized by the consecration as lord of the three realms by that consecration is

original: rdo rje rin chen dbang bskur dpal //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen dbang bskur dpal //
translated: the glory of the consecration of the vajra gem.

original: zhes bya'o // rin po che thams cad la dbang bskur bas /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rin po che thams cad la dbang bskur bas /
translated: By the consecration of all jewels,

original: rin po che'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de la de rnams kyi dbang phyug rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pas na /
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de la de rnams kyi dbang phyug rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pas na /
translated: In that maṇḍala of the jewel family, he resides as the lord of them all, by the very nature of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: rin chen kun bdag dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: rin chen kun bdag dbang phyug ste //
translated: He is the lord of all jewels.

original: zhes bya'o // 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams ni /
translated: In the maṇḍala of the subjugators of the world,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug kun te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug kun te /
translated: he is the lord of all lords of the world.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bdag po'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bdag po'o //
translated: He is the lord of them all, by the very nature of Amitābha.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams ni rdo rje 'chang ba kun no //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams ni rdo rje 'chang ba kun no //
translated: In the maṇḍala of the conquerors of the three realms, he is all vajra holders.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /🔽sangs rgyas h'um mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste / sangs rgyas h'um mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
translated: He is the lord of them all, by the very nature of Mahāvajradhara.

original: rdo rje 'chang ba kun gyi rje //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba kun gyi rje //
translated: He is the lord of all vajra holders.

original: zhes bya'o // sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs ni sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs ni sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen po ste /
translated: The mind of omniscience, which is the nature of the nondual wisdom and great compassion of all the buddhas, is the great mind of all the buddhas.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since it is the essence of that,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs che ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs che ba //
translated: it is the great mind of all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi thugs la khyab pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi thugs la khyab pas na /
translated: Since it pervades the mind of equality with all the tathagatas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
translated: it abides in the mind of all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad kyis rjes @238b su brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad sku'i gzugs su bdag nyid ston pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad kyis rjes @238b su brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad sku'i gzugs su bdag nyid ston pas na /
translated: Since it displays itself as the form of the body of all the buddhas, who are adorned with all the major and minor marks,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku che ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku che ba //
translated: it is the great body of all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung thams cad la 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung thams cad la 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
translated: Since it is the cause for engaging in all the speech of all the tathagatas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin //
translated: it is also the speech of all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // rdo rje ye shes kyi nyi ma'i tshul gyis phyi dang nang gi mun pa dang / ma rig pa sel bar mdzad cing snang bar gyur pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rdo rje ye shes kyi nyi ma'i tshul gyis phyi dang nang gi mun pa dang / ma rig pa sel bar mdzad cing snang bar gyur pas na /
translated: By the method of the vajra-wisdom sun, he dispels the outer and inner darkness and ignorance, and becomes the light.

original: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che //
translated: Therefore, he is the vajra sun, the great light.

original: zhes bya'o // mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi zla ba'i gzugs kyis nyon mongs pa'i gdud ba sel bar mdzad cing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi zla ba'i gzugs kyis nyon mongs pa'i gdud ba sel bar mdzad cing /
translated: By the form of the indivisible wisdom moon, he dispels the defilements of the afflictions.

original: dri ma med de /
analyzed: dri ma med de /
translated: He is stainless.

original: bsil zhing yid sim par byed pa'i 'od zer rab tu gtong bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: bsil zhing yid sim par byed pa'i 'od zer rab tu gtong bar mdzad pas na /
translated: He emits the light of the cooling and refreshing nectar.

original: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
analyzed: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
translated: Therefore, he is the vajra moon, the stainless light.

original: ces bya'o // chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa gdul bya'i sems can rnams 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽shin tu mngon par zhen par mdzad pas na //
analyzed: ces bya'o // chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa gdul bya'i sems can rnams 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir / shin tu mngon par zhen par mdzad pas na //
translated: In order to tame the sentient beings to be tamed, such as those who are free from attachment,🔽he is very attached.

original: chags bral la sogs chags pa che //
analyzed: chags bral la sogs chags pa che //
translated: Therefore, he is the great attachment of those free from attachment, and so forth.

original: zhes bya'o // phyi rol gyi 'od de nyid kha dog sna tshogs par 'bar zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // phyi rol gyi 'od de nyid kha dog sna tshogs par 'bar zhing /
translated: That very external light blazes with various colors.

original: yid kyi las rnams mchog tu ston pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yid kyi las rnams mchog tu ston pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is the supreme teaching of the activities of the mind.

original: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
translated: The blazing light of various colors.

original: ces bya'o // yang na stong pa nyid dang thugs rje chen po can gyi snying po dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // yang na stong pa nyid dang thugs rje chen po can gyi snying po dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Or else, that is called the essence of emptiness and great compassion, the mind of enlightenment.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu shin tu che ba nyid kyi rgyur gyur pas na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs te /
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu shin tu che ba nyid kyi rgyur gyur pas na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs te /
translated: That itself is the cause of the great fruit of buddhahood, and so it is the mind of all buddhas.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it is the essence of the mind of enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs che ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs che ba //
translated: it is the great mind of all buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // de nying dpag tu med pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje'i gzugs su gyur nas //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nying dpag tu med pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje'i gzugs su gyur nas //
translated: That itself becomes the form of the vajra of immeasurable mental nature,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kyi rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kyi rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
translated: and becomes the essence of the mind vajra of all buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
translated: Therefore, it is said to abide in the mind of all buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // rdo rje yongs su gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i ngo bor gyur pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rdo rje yongs su gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i ngo bor gyur pas na /
translated: Having become the vajra, it becomes the essence of the body of all tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku che ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku che ba'o //
translated: Is the great body of all the buddhas.

original: ljags kyi padma'i zla ba dang / rdo rje'i steng du dkar po dang / dkar po ma yin pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs kyi gsung gi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bas na /
analyzed: ljags kyi padma'i zla ba dang / rdo rje'i steng du dkar po dang / dkar po ma yin pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs kyi gsung gi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bas na /
translated: The wheel of speech, in the form of the seal of the Dharma, white and not white, is fully turned on the moon and vajra above the lotus of the tongue.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin //
translated: Therefore, he is the speech of all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya'o // shin tu yongs su rdzogs nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rgyab tu 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs kyi dbyer med par /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // shin tu yongs su rdzogs nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rgyab tu 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs kyi dbyer med par /
translated: Having been completely perfected, he is the nature of all the buddhas, inseparable from the form of the mandala of light on his back.

original: thams cad la snang ba chen por mdzad pas na /
analyzed: thams cad la snang ba chen por mdzad pas na /
translated: He makes a great appearance to all,

original: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che ba'o //🔽thugs kyi zla ba'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus su gnyis @239a * //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che ba'o // thugs kyi zla ba'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus su gnyis @239a * //
translated: Therefore, he is the great light of the vajra sun.

original: su med par snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba chen po'i 'od zer dri ma med pa rab tu dgyes pa'i gzugs kyis gnas pas na /
analyzed: su med par snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba chen po'i 'od zer dri ma med pa rab tu dgyes pa'i gzugs kyis gnas pas na /
translated: In the center of the vajra in the moon of the mind, he is in union with the nondual union, abiding in the form of the stainless light rays of great bliss,

original: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od do //
analyzed: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od do //
translated: Therefore, he is the stainless light of the vajra moon.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi rang gi ngo bo 'ba' zhig gis bzhugs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi rang gi ngo bo 'ba' zhig gis bzhugs par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does he abide in the nature of the Lord of all Buddhas,

original: gzhan yang dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad kyis gzugs rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad kyis gzugs rnams kyis kyang /
translated: but also in the forms of all the deities of the mandala.

original: de nyid thabs sna tshogs la dgyes shing sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pas na /
analyzed: de nyid thabs sna tshogs la dgyes shing sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pas na /
translated: Since he delights in various methods and abides in various forms,

original: chags bral la sogs chags pa che //
analyzed: chags bral la sogs chags pa che //
translated: he is the great passion of those free from passion, and so on.

original: zhes bya'o // kha dog sna chogs pa'i lha rnams kyi sku mdog dang 'od kyi kha dog gi dbya bas gcig pu yang thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // kha dog sna chogs pa'i lha rnams kyi sku mdog dang 'od kyi kha dog gi dbya bas gcig pu yang thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the deities of various colors have the nature of all in their body colors and the various colors of their light,

original: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
translated: he is the blazing light of various colors.

original: ces bya'o // brla g-yas pa la rkang pa g-yon pa gzhag pa /
analyzed: ces bya'o // brla g-yas pa la rkang pa g-yon pa gzhag pa /
translated: He places his left foot on his right thigh,

original: brla g-yon pa la rkang pa g-yas pa gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: brla g-yon pa la rkang pa g-yas pa gzhag pa ni //
translated: and his right foot on his left thigh.

original: rdo rje skyil mo krung yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil mo krung yin te /
translated: This is the vajra posture,

original: g-yon pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: the left being wisdom,

original: g-yas pa ni thabs te /
analyzed: g-yas pa ni thabs te /
translated: and the right being method.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab mi phyed pas //
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab mi phyed pas //
translated: Thus, since method and wisdom are inseparable,🔽he is the vajra posture.

original: bdud thams cad 'jigs par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi /
analyzed: bdud thams cad 'jigs par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi /
translated: The nature of all demons is to be feared.

original: skyil mo krung ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yin pas na /
analyzed: skyil mo krung ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yin pas na /
translated: The cross-legged posture is that of all Buddhas.🔽Therefore,

original: rdo rje'i skyil krung rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skyil krung rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: The vajra posture is the perfect Buddha.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: And,

original: de yang / rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas ni //
analyzed: de yang / rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas ni //
translated: Having assumed the vajra posture,

original: bdud rnams thams cad rab tu 'joms //🔽zhes gsungs bas so //
analyzed: bdud rnams thams cad rab tu 'joms // zhes gsungs bas so //
translated: One conquers all demons.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'gro ba ni /
translated: The Buddhas go to

original: 'dus nas chos kyi 'brel ba'i gtam mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus nas chos kyi 'brel ba'i gtam mdzad pa'o //
translated: where they gather and have discussions about the Dharma.

original: de yang thun mong ma yin pas sangs rgyas kho na la srid kyi gzhan la ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de yang thun mong ma yin pas sangs rgyas kho na la srid kyi gzhan la ma yin pas na /
translated: And, since that is not common to others, it is possible only for the Buddhas, not for others.🔽Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i chos 'dzin pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i chos 'dzin pa'o // gang gi phyir /
translated: The Buddhas go to the Dharma.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pas na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs pas na /
translated: Because they have completed the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ldan no //
translated: They are glorious.

original: gos pa med pa'i chos nyid du chos mthun pas na /
analyzed: gos pa med pa'i chos nyid du chos mthun pas na /
translated: Since they are similar in being the reality of non-attachment,

original: sangs rgyas nyid padma ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid padma ste /
translated: Buddhahood is a lotus.

original: de rnams las byung ba'i skye ba'i chos kyi skye gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams las byung ba'i skye ba'i chos kyi skye gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the birthplace of the Dharma of birth that arises from them.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas padma skyes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma skyes zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called the Buddha, the Lotus-born.

original: kun mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa ste /
translated: He is the Omniscient One,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mdzod 'dzin par mdzad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mdzod 'dzin par mdzad cing /
translated: the holder of the treasury of the wisdom of all the Buddhas.

original: tshogs gnyis ma chang ba mad pas te /
analyzed: tshogs gnyis ma chang ba mad pas te /
translated: Since he is not lacking in the two accumulations,

original: 'dzin pa'i nus pa mnga' bas na /🔽dpal dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i nus pa mnga' bas na / dpal dang ldan zhing /
translated: he has the power of retention.🔽Therefore,

original: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //🔽zhes bya'o // 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs shing /
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa // zhes bya'o // 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs shing /
translated: he is the glorious one, the holder of the treasury of omniscient wisdom.

original: tha dad pa'i 'gro ba rnams la sbrul ba'i sgyu 'phrul spro ba la bdag por gyur cing thams cad du sprul ba'i byed pa por @239b gyur pas na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i 'gro ba rnams la sbrul ba'i sgyu 'phrul spro ba la bdag por gyur cing thams cad du sprul ba'i byed pa por @239b gyur pas na /
translated: He is the lord of the emanation of the various kinds of magical emanations for the various kinds of migrating beings, and he is the creator of all emanations.🔽Therefore,

original: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang //
analyzed: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang //
translated: he is the king, the holder of the various kinds of magical emanations.

original: zhes bya'o // sangs rgyas rnams ni rig pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sangs rgyas rnams ni rig pa ni /
translated: The Buddhas are the knowledge

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rig pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sprul pa mdzad pa'i bdag nyid chen po dang / shin tu ldan pas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rig pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sprul pa mdzad pa'i bdag nyid chen po dang / shin tu ldan pas na /
translated: The great being who, by the power of the knowledge of the perfection of wisdom, creates emanations mundane and supramundane,

original: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna chogs 'chang //
analyzed: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna chogs 'chang //
translated: is the king who holds the various magical creations.

original: che ba sangs rgyas rig sngags rgyal //
analyzed: che ba sangs rgyas rig sngags rgyal //
translated: The great one is the Buddha, the king of knowledge-mantras.

original: zhes bya'o // da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi don ngo bo nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi don ngo bo nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir / rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of the mantra explained by the Lord as his very essence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Vajra sharpness, great sword,” and so on.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par shin tu yang so sor rtogs pas na rdo rje rnon po'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par shin tu yang so sor rtogs pas na rdo rje rnon po'o //
translated: He is Vajra sharpness because he thoroughly realizes the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: bdag tu gti mug pa la dmigs pa'i rtsa ba can 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i shing chen po gcod par mdzad pas na ral gri chen po'o //
