analyzed: bdag tu gti mug pa la dmigs pa'i rtsa ba can 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i shing chen po gcod par mdzad pas na ral gri chen po'o //
translated: He is the great sword because he cuts down the great tree of afflictions, which has the root of the view of the transitory collection, which is the focus of the delusion of self, along with its branches, leaves, and petals.

original: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi 'gyur zhing mi zad ba la rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur bas yi ge mchog ste /
analyzed: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi 'gyur zhing mi zad ba la rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur bas yi ge mchog ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the perfection of wisdom is the supreme syllable because it is unchanging and inexhaustible, and its own nature does not change into something else.

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: It is the Dharma Body.

original: sna tshogs pa'i mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma mang mnga' bas na rnam par dag ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma mang mnga' bas na rnam par dag ba'o //
translated: It is completely pure because it possesses many stains of various unreal conceptual thoughts.

original: de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: And this is taught as follows:

original: des par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ma lus par bcad pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi sku thugs su chud pas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gyur pa ni badzra t'ikshna zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no //
analyzed: des par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ma lus par bcad pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi sku thugs su chud pas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gyur pa ni badzra t'ikshna zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the mantra vajra-tīkṣṇa is that by the wisdom of thorough differentiation, all afflictions and suffering are completely cut off, and by realizing the completely pure Dharma Body, it becomes non-conceptual.

original: sngags gnyis pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngags gnyis pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the second mantra,

original: theg pa chen po sdug bsngal gcod //
analyzed: theg pa chen po sdug bsngal gcod //
translated: The Great Vehicle cuts off suffering,

original: mtshon cha chen po rdo rje chos //
analyzed: mtshon cha chen po rdo rje chos //
translated: The great weapon, the vajra of Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is taught.

original: sdug bsngal ma lus par gcod pa ni theg pa chen po nyid kyis nus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma lus par gcod pa ni theg pa chen po nyid kyis nus so //
translated: The Great Vehicle alone is able to eliminate all suffering.

original: de pas na sdug bsngal ma lus pa gcod pa'i bdag nyid can theg pa chen po dang / de'i rdo rje'i chos nyid mi phyed pa yin te /
analyzed: de pas na sdug bsngal ma lus pa gcod pa'i bdag nyid can theg pa chen po dang / de'i rdo rje'i chos nyid mi phyed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Great Vehicle, which has the nature of eliminating all suffering, and its indivisible vajra nature,

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid ni sems can ma lus pa'i the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i phyir mtshon cha chen po'o ;
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid ni sems can ma lus pa'i the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i phyir mtshon cha chen po'o ;
translated: are the great weapon, because that very nondual wisdom eliminates all the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: / de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: theg pa chen po thams cad ni rdo rje'i chos nyid kyi don ston pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad ni rdo rje'i chos nyid kyi don ston pa yin te /
translated: The entire Great Vehicle teaches the meaning of the vajra nature.

original: du: khatstshe da zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no //
analyzed: du: khatstshe da zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the mantra duḥkhasatya.

original: sngags gsum pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rdo rje zab mo dzin dzik //
analyzed: sngags gsum pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir / rdo rje zab mo dzin dzik //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the third mantra,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The profound vajra, Jñānakāya.”

original: sangs rgyas shes rab ye shes kyi //🔽snying @240a * //🔽po dzin dzik tu bshad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas shes rab ye shes kyi // snying @240a * // po dzin dzik tu bshad //
translated: The wisdom of the buddhas

original: ces gsungs pas /
analyzed: ces gsungs pas /
translated: is explained as Jñānakāya.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs pas phyed cing rtogs par dka' la /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs pas phyed cing rtogs par dka' la /
translated: Since he has completely perfected the four right discriminations, he is difficult to fathom and understand.

original: mnyam pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi blo dang ldan pas na rdo rje ltar zab pa ni rdo rje blo gros so //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi blo dang ldan pas na rdo rje ltar zab pa ni rdo rje blo gros so //
translated: Since he possesses the incomparable mind of a buddha, he is profound like a vajra, and so he is Vajra Wisdom.

original: de nyid kyis na don bzhin rig / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na don bzhin rig / ces bya ba ste /
translated: And so he knows the meaning as it is.

original: rdo rje ltar chos thams cad so sor 'bigs pa'i shes rab kyis zab cing rgya che ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thugs su chud pa dang / shes bya ma lus par thugs su chud pa yang myur du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ltar chos thams cad so sor 'bigs pa'i shes rab kyis zab cing rgya che ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thugs su chud pa dang / shes bya ma lus par thugs su chud pa yang myur du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Since he is profound like a vajra, he has realized the vast qualities of a buddha with the wisdom that individually penetrates all phenomena, and he will quickly realize all objects of knowledge without exception.

original: pradzny'a dzny'a na zhes bya ba sngags kyi don to //
analyzed: pradzny'a dzny'a na zhes bya ba sngags kyi don to //
translated: Prajñājñāna is the meaning of the mantra.

original: yi ge bcu gnyis pa'i sngags kyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽pha rol phyin pa kun rdzogs pa //🔽sa rnams kun gyi rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: yi ge bcu gnyis pa'i sngags kyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir / pha rol phyin pa kun rdzogs pa // sa rnams kun gyi rgyan dang ldan //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the twelve-syllable mantra,🔽he is endowed with the perfection of all perfections,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and with the ornament of all the stages.

original: sa bcu gnyis dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis ji lta ba nyid ni de nyid du yi ge bshad pa'i skabs su rgya cher sbyar zin pas 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis ji lta ba nyid ni de nyid du yi ge bshad pa'i skabs su rgya cher sbyar zin pas 'dir ma spros so //
translated: The twelve stages and twelve perfections are just as they are extensively applied in the section on the explanation of the syllables in the very same text, so I will not elaborate on them here.

original: pha rol phyin pa thams cad rdzogs par mnga' bas na /
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa thams cad rdzogs par mnga' bas na /
translated: Since he is endowed with the perfection of all perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa kun rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa kun rdzogs pa'o //
translated: he is the one who perfects all perfections.

original: sa thams cad kyis rnam pa sna tshogs par brgyan pa des nas thams cad ni rgyan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sa thams cad kyis rnam pa sna tshogs par brgyan pa des nas thams cad ni rgyan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Since he is adorned with all the stages in various ways, all the stages are ornaments.

original: des brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: des brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is adorned by him

original: sa rnams kun gyi rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: sa rnams kun gyi rgyan dang ldan //
translated: is endowed with the ornament of all stages.

original: zhes bya'o // sngags bzhi ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sngags bzhi ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the fourth mantra,

original: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says “pure” and so on.

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don ston pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu la slu ba med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don ston pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu la slu ba med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Pure phenomena are the wisdom of selflessness itself, because it teaches the unmistaken meaning, and it is right wisdom because it is undeceiving with regard to the result of buddhahood.

original: de yang snying la gnas ba'i ma rig pa'i mun nag sel ba'i 'od gsal ba bskyed pas na /
analyzed: de yang snying la gnas ba'i ma rig pa'i mun nag sel ba'i 'od gsal ba bskyed pas na /
translated: Moreover, it is the light that generates the clear light that dispels the darkness of ignorance that resides in the heart.

original: rnam par dag pa bdag med chos //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bdag med chos //
translated: The pure Dharma is selfless.

original: yang dag ye shes zla 'od bzang //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes zla 'od bzang //
translated: The moon of right wisdom is good.

original: zhes bya'o // de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /🔽phyi dang nang gi bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i rnam par dag pa'i chos la bdag med par thugs su chud pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi ye shes kyi sku brnyes bas na bde ba
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te / phyi dang nang gi bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i rnam par dag pa'i chos la bdag med par thugs su chud pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi ye shes kyi sku brnyes bas na bde ba
translated: Moreover, this is taught as follows:

original: dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The pure Dharma, which is free from the self and mine, both internal and external, is realized as selfless. Therefore, one attains the wisdom body, which is the nature of the wisdom and knowledge of the mundane and supramundane. Thus, one becomes endowed with bliss.

original: dzny'a na k'a ya zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no //
analyzed: dzny'a na k'a ya zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the mantra jñāna-kāya.

original: sngags lnga pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngags lnga pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the five-syllable mantra,

original: brtson chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brtson chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “great effort,” and so on.

original: sgyu 'phrul ni sprul ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul ni sprul ba'o //
translated: Illusion is emanation.

original: sgyu 'phrul nyid 'ching ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas na dra ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul nyid 'ching ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas na dra ba'o //
translated: Since illusion itself has the nature of bondage, it is a net.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen @240b po brtul ba gang la yod pa de la ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen @240b po brtul ba gang la yod pa de la ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called the Great Magician because he has subdued the great magicians.

original: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / lha rnams kyi rnal 'byor dang / las kyi tshogs la sogs pa rgyud cing nges par bya ba byed pas na rgyud do //
analyzed: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / lha rnams kyi rnal 'byor dang / las kyi tshogs la sogs pa rgyud cing nges par bya ba byed pas na rgyud do //
translated: A tantra is so called because it causes one to be bound to and to ascertain the mantra, seal, mandala, deity yoga, and the collection of rites, etc.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi bdag po'i mchog ni rje btsun 'jam pa'i dbyangs ji lta ba nyid de /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi bdag po'i mchog ni rje btsun 'jam pa'i dbyangs ji lta ba nyid de /
translated: The supreme lord of all tantras is just Mañjuśrī, the venerable one.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi bdag por gyur pas gsung gi 'khor lo thams cad bskor bas na b'a ga'i shva ra zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no ;
analyzed: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi bdag por gyur pas gsung gi 'khor lo thams cad bskor bas na b'a ga'i shva ra zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi don yin no ;
translated: The meaning of the mantra is that he is called Vāgīśvara because he is the lord of the tantras of action, conduct, and yoga, and because he turns the wheel of speech with the form of various emanations such as mantra, seal, mandala, etc.

original: / sngags grub pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / sngags grub pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of mantra accomplishment,🔽he says:

original: rdo rje'i gdan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line the vajra seat and so forth is stated.

original: rdo rje ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / mtshon par gyur pa ni chos thams cad yi ge lngas mtshan pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / mtshon par gyur pa ni chos thams cad yi ge lngas mtshan pa yin te /
translated: The entire vajra is the sign of the perfection of the tathagatas, and the emblem is all phenomena marked by the five syllables.

original: de yang aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: de yang aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Moreover, a is the door of all phenomena.

original: ra ni chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad ni thugs rje chen pos chags par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ra ni chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad ni thugs rje chen pos chags par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The ra is the freedom from dust of all phenomena, and the passion of all buddhas by means of great compassion.

original: pa ni skye ba med pa dang / thugs rje chen po'i chags pa'i thugs rje dang thabs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas na don dam pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni skye ba med pa dang / thugs rje chen po'i chags pa'i thugs rje dang thabs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas na don dam pa'o //
translated: The pa is the non-arising, and the ultimate because of being the mind of passion by means of great compassion and the nature of method.

original: tsa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa de dag gi rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa de dag gi rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The tsa is the cause of the stages and perfections and so forth, and the freedom from those.

original: na ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar nye bar dmigs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi sku'i mthar thug pa'o zhes ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: na ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar nye bar dmigs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi sku'i mthar thug pa'o zhes ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: Na is the ultimate reality of the dharmakaya, free from all obscurations, which is perceived as being like space.

original: de bas na yi ge lnga'i sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na /🔽ye shes sku rnams ma lus 'chang ;
analyzed: de bas na yi ge lnga'i sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na / ye shes sku rnams ma lus 'chang ;
translated: Therefore, because it is the essence of the reality of the five-syllable mantra,

original: / zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to be “endowed with all the wisdom bodies.”🔽It is Samantabhadra, because it is the good, the desired object, of all sentient beings in every way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du kun nas sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don bzang po mdzad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du bzang zhing sdug pas na kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du kun nas sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don bzang po mdzad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du bzang zhing sdug pas na kun du bzang po'o //
translated: It is Samantabhadra, because it is good and beautiful in every way.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa rdzogs pa bskyed pa'i blo gros bzang po mnga' bas na blo gros bzang po'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa rdzogs pa bskyed pa'i blo gros bzang po mnga' bas na blo gros bzang po'o //
translated: It is Manjusri, because it is the good thought that generates the perfection of benefit for self and other.

original: sa bzhin du mi 'gyur bar sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: sa bzhin du mi 'gyur bar sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na sa'i snying po'o //
translated: It is Kshitigarbha, because it is the cause for the generation and support of all sentient beings, like the earth.

original: sems can gyi snod kyi ngo bo nyid 'gro ba rnams rnam par 'dzin pa'i rgyu bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na 'gro ba 'dzin pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad kyi @241a * //🔽skye gnas chen po ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi snod kyi ngo bo nyid 'gro ba rnams rnam par 'dzin pa'i rgyu bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na 'gro ba 'dzin pa'o // sangs rgyas thams cad kyi @241a * // skye gnas chen po ni /
translated: The cause of holding the world of sentient beings is the accumulation of merit and wisdom, so it is the holder of the world.🔽The great source of all buddhas

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi snying po che // zhes bya ste /

analyzed: bskyed pa la yang yod de /

translated: This is so.🔽Here, the wise should infer and apply the rest,

original: bcom ldan 'das rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi don thams cad grub pa nam mkha' ltar dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i don gyi dgos pa sbas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi don thams cad grub pa nam mkha' ltar dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i don gyi dgos pa sbas te /
translated: The Bhagavān, the venerable Mañjuśrī, the essence of the wisdom of the completely pure, stainless dharmadhātu, like space, is hidden in the great maṇḍala called Sarvārthasiddhi.

original: 'dug pas na phyin ci ma log pa'i man ngag las brgyud de 'ongs pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug pas na phyin ci ma log pa'i man ngag las brgyud de 'ongs pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be explained as coming through the lineage of unerring intimate instructions.

original: da ni dkyus ma nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dkyus ma nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Now, one should enter the main part.

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
translated: The holder of the nature of all things,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dka' 'grel gyi tshul du byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dka' 'grel gyi tshul du byas te /
translated: This and so forth is done in the manner of a commentary on the difficult points.

original: shin tu rgya che bar ni ma spros so //
analyzed: shin tu rgya che bar ni ma spros so //
translated: It is not elaborated in great detail.

original: de la dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni skye ba med pa'i stong pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni skye ba med pa'i stong pa ste /
translated: Therein, the nature of all things is the emptiness of non-arising.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis na mchog ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis na mchog ste /
translated: By virtue of such an essence, it is supreme.

original: gtso bo yin pas na /
analyzed: gtso bo yin pas na /
translated: Since it is the principal one,

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: it is called “the supreme nature of all things.”

original: de nyid kyis na /🔽dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
translated: By virtue of that,🔽it is called “the nature of all things.”

original: zhes bya'o // chos can gyi ngo bo nyid du bshad nas //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // chos can gyi ngo bo nyid du bshad nas //
translated: Having explained the essence of the subject,

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽skye med chos te sna tshogs don //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir / skye med chos te sna tshogs don //
translated: in order to demonstrate the essence of phenomena,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gang la skye ba med pa'i chos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang la skye ba med pa'i chos te /
translated: it is said, “The non-arising of phenomena is the various objects.”

original: chos can la brten pa nyid kyis brtags na skye ba med pas na /
analyzed: chos can la brten pa nyid kyis brtags na skye ba med pas na /
translated: Since it is imputed by virtue of being dependent on the subject, it does not arise.

original: de la brten pa'i chos rnams ni shin tu yang skye ba med pa nyid do zhes pa'i skye ba med pa'i don ni chos thams cad kyi don yin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i chos rnams ni shin tu yang skye ba med pa nyid do zhes pa'i skye ba med pa'i don ni chos thams cad kyi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of non-arising is the meaning of all phenomena.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos kun ngo bo nyid 'chang ba //
analyzed: chos kun ngo bo nyid 'chang ba //
translated: all phenomena are held to be essentially non-arising.🔽In order to demonstrate that there is no sequence of conceptualized phenomena, there is also no sequence of concepts,

original: zhes bya'o // rtog par bya ba'i chos kyi rim pa med @241b pas rtog pa'i rim pa yang med do zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rtog par bya ba'i chos kyi rim pa med @241b pas rtog pa'i rim pa yang med do zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: shes rab chen pos skad cig la /🔽chos kun khong du chud pa 'chang //
analyzed: shes rab chen pos skad cig la / chos kun khong du chud pa 'chang //
translated: In a single instant, with great wisdom,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: all phenomena are held to be fully comprehended.

original: 'di ltar phrin las yongs su shas cher sbyangs pa shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab chen po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phrin las yongs su shas cher sbyangs pa shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab chen po yin te /
translated: Thus, great wisdom is the essence of fully comprehending all objects of knowledge through thoroughly purifying one's activity.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma gcig gis chos thams cad thugs su chud pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma gcig gis chos thams cad thugs su chud pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin la /
translated: Because in a single instant, all phenomena are fully comprehended, it is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na /🔽shes rab chen pos skad cig la /
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na / shes rab chen pos skad cig la /
translated: He is the holder of that nature.🔽He is the holder of all dharmas in an instant

original: chos kun khong du chud pa 'chang //🔽zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: chos kun khong du chud pa 'chang // zhes bshad do ;
translated: with great wisdom.

original: /'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: /'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i chos thams cad do //
translated: All dharmas are divided into conditioned and unconditioned, with and without impurity, mundane and supramundane.

original: sde rnams mngon par rtogs pa ni thugs su chud pa ste /
analyzed: sde rnams mngon par rtogs pa ni thugs su chud pa ste /
translated: The realization of the collections is his understanding.

original: rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is the realization of all aspects is

original: chos kun mngon par rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: chos kun mngon par rtogs pa ste //
translated: the realization of all dharmas.

original: zhes bya'o // thub pa zhes bya ba ni sku dang / gsung dang / thugs thub pa dang ldan pas mi dge bcu'i las kyi lam las ldog cing dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par ldan pas na thub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // thub pa zhes bya ba ni sku dang / gsung dang / thugs thub pa dang ldan pas mi dge bcu'i las kyi lam las ldog cing dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par ldan pas na thub pa'o //
translated: The Muni is so called because he is endowed with the muni of body, speech, and mind, because he turns away from the ten unwholesome courses of action and is endowed with all wholesome dharmas.

original: blo mchog ni chos thams cad du thugs su chung pa dang ldan pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni blo mchog go //
analyzed: blo mchog ni chos thams cad du thugs su chung pa dang ldan pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni blo mchog go //
translated: The highest mind is the mind endowed with the understanding of all dharmas.

original: 'byung ba ni bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni bden pa ste /
translated: The emergence is the truth,

original: de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality.

original: de'i mthar ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mthar ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The end of that is the ultimate.

original: de kho na nyid kyi mtha' thugs su chud pa ni 'byung po'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mtha' thugs su chud pa ni 'byung po'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding of the end of reality is called the end of the emergence.

original: yang na 'byung po ni srog chags rnams so //
analyzed: yang na 'byung po ni srog chags rnams so //
translated: Or else, the emergence is the living beings.

original: de'i mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The end of that is nirvana.

original: skye ba'i mthar thug pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis thub pa ni thub pa yang dag mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i mthar thug pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis thub pa ni thub pa yang dag mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: The ultimate of birth is nirvana, because of the nature of non-abiding nirvana. The Sage is called the perfect end.

original: mi g-yo rab tu dang ba'i bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la gnas ngan len dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pas na brtan zhing mi 'gyur bar gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo rab tu dang ba'i bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la gnas ngan len dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pas na brtan zhing mi 'gyur bar gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The self of unshakable clear faith, etc. means: because of the abandonment of all bad dispositions and conceptualizations, the unshakable is the firm, unchanging abode.

original: ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral bas shin tu yang rab kyi mthar thug pas dri ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas na rab tu snang ba'i bdag go //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral bas shin tu yang rab kyi mthar thug pas dri ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas na rab tu snang ba'i bdag go //
translated: Since it is free from the turbidity of ignorance, attachment, and so on, it is the ultimate of all that is extremely pure, and since it is the nature of the body that is the nature of the immaculate essence, it is the nature of the body that is the nature of the immaculate essence.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye @242a * //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye @242a * //
translated: Perfect complete enlightenment is the knowledge of elimination and non-arising.

original: shes te ; nyon mongs pa ma lus par zad pa dang / slar yang mi skye bdag ni dus gcig pa ste /
analyzed: shes te ; nyon mongs pa ma lus par zad pa dang / slar yang mi skye bdag ni dus gcig pa ste /
translated: The complete elimination of afflictions and the non-arising of them again occur at the same time.

original: rkun ma phyung ba dang / sgo gtan bcug pa lta bu dang / tshul mthun no zhes bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod do //
analyzed: rkun ma phyung ba dang / sgo gtan bcug pa lta bu dang / tshul mthun no zhes bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod do //
translated: This is like a thief being expelled and the door being shut, and is consistent with the method. This is asserted by the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dri ma med pa'i byang chub bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dri ma med pa'i byang chub bshad par bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and non-arising, which is immaculate enlightenment, should be explained.

original: zad pa med pa ni mi skye ba'i mtha' yin par rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa med pa ni mi skye ba'i mtha' yin par rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The end of non-arising should be understood in the same order as elimination.

original: de yang 'dus byas thams cad zad pa'i tshul nyid ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas thams cad zad pa'i tshul nyid ni stong pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the very mode of the exhaustion of all conditioned things is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na 'dus byas nyid 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na 'dus byas nyid 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Since it is the very essence of emptiness, conditioned things are unconditioned.

original: de bas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid zad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all conditioned and unconditioned things are the same in being exhausted.

original: zad pa de yang 'grib pa med de //
analyzed: zad pa de yang 'grib pa med de //
translated: That exhaustion is not a decrease.

original: gang gi phyir zad pa de la ni zad pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zad pa de la ni zad pa med do //
translated: Because that exhaustion is not exhausted.

original: gal te zad pa zad par gyur na ni 'gog pa yang zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te zad pa zad par gyur na ni 'gog pa yang zad par 'gyur te /
translated: If that exhaustion were exhausted, cessation would also be exhausted.

original: 'gog pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'dod do //
translated: Since that would entail the consequence that there would be no cessation, that is unacceptable.

original: de bas na zad pa ni zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na zad pa ni zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, exhaustion is not exhausted.

original: gang zad par mi 'gyur ba de ni mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang zad par mi 'gyur ba de ni mi skye ba'o //
translated: That which is not exhausted is unborn.

original: gang mi skye ba de ni 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mi skye ba de ni 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is unborn does not cease.

original: de ltar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du rtogs pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du rtogs pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: Thus, the realization of the sameness of all phenomena and the suchness of all phenomena is awakening.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes ni byang chub ces bya la /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes ni byang chub ces bya la /
translated: The gnosis of extinction and non-production is called enlightenment.

original: de de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
translated: Since it is the nature of that, it is

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub 'chang //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub 'chang //
translated: The perfect Buddha, the holder of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya'o // sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol pa'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad snang ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas me lce dang 'dra bas na ye shes me lce ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol pa'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad snang ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas me lce dang 'dra bas na ye shes me lce ste /
translated: The gnosis that is completely liberated from all obscurations has the nature of the appearance of all objects of knowledge, so it is like a flame.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du 'od rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du 'od rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: It is the light that shines in all ways.

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kun gyi mngon sum pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kun gyi mngon sum pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the direct perception of all the buddhas in all ways.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni nam yang mngon sum du ma gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni nam yang mngon sum du ma gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The enlightenment of the buddhas is never not a direct perception.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas mngon sum du gyur pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes me lce 'od rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas mngon sum du gyur pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes me lce 'od rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the enlightenment of all buddhas, the flame of gnosis of all buddhas is the light that shines in all ways.

original: 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “the desired aim” is as follows.

original: 'dod pa ni dgos pa'i gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni dgos pa'i gtso bo ste /
translated: The desired aim is the principal purpose,

original: sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: which is Buddhahood.🔽The subsidiary aims are heaven,🔽enjoyment,🔽mastery,

original: mtho ris dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug dang / rig 'dzin grub pa la sogs pa ni zhar la 'grub ste /
analyzed: mtho ris dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug dang / rig 'dzin grub pa la sogs pa ni zhar la 'grub ste /
translated: and the accomplishments of the knowledge-bearers, etc.

original: de bas na dgos pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'dod pa'i don grub pa ni rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dgos pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'dod pa'i don grub pa ni rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of the desired aim is the fulfillment of both kinds of aims.

original: mchog ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rtsol ba'i phul du byung ba yin pas @242b na ;
analyzed: mchog ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rtsol ba'i phul du byung ba yin pas @242b na ;
translated: The supreme aim is the most excellent fruit of mundane and supramundane striving.

original: 'dod pa'i don dam sgrub pa ste //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don dam sgrub pa ste //
translated: Thus, it is the accomplishment of the ultimate aim.

original: zhes bya'o // sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gror 'gro ba 'jug par byed pa'i las kyi gnyen por gyur pa thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams ston par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gror 'gro ba 'jug par byed pa'i las kyi gnyen por gyur pa thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams ston par mdzad pas na /
translated: The Lord teaches the Dharma which is the antidote to the karma that causes beings to enter the realms of hell, ghosts, and animals, and which is conducive to liberation.

original: ngan song thams cad rnam sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song thams cad rnam sbyong ba'o //
translated: Thus, he purifies all evil destinies.

original: mgon po sems can kun gyi mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: mgon po sems can kun gyi mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: The Lord is the supreme of all beings.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis sems can thams cad yongs su grol bar mdzad pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis sems can thams cad yongs su grol bar mdzad pas /
translated: Because he liberates all sentient beings by the power of his skill in all the bonds of affliction,🔽he is the one hero in the battle against the afflictions,

original: sems can thams cad rab grol byed //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rab grol byed //
translated: who liberates all sentient beings.

original: ces bya'o // sems cad rnams kun nas nyon mongs pas na nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // sems cad rnams kun nas nyon mongs pas na nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Sentient beings are afflicted by the afflictions,

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: which are the roots of attachment, etc., that are the manifest clinging to self and “mine”.

original: de dang lhan cig tu g-yul sprod pas na nyon mongs pa'i g-yul der dpa' bo gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu g-yul sprod pas na nyon mongs pa'i g-yul der dpa' bo gcig pa'o //
translated: He is the one hero in the battle against the afflictions, because he fights with them together.

original: dgra gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dgra gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the enemy?

original: mi shes pa'i dgra bo de'i dregs pa ni bdag nyid gcig bu nyid kyis sems can ma lus pa mi shes pa'i zhags pas bcings la ngan song gsum du lhung bar bya'o zhes brnyas pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i dgra bo de'i dregs pa ni bdag nyid gcig bu nyid kyis sems can ma lus pa mi shes pa'i zhags pas bcings la ngan song gsum du lhung bar bya'o zhes brnyas pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The arrogance of the enemy of nescience is the contempt that thinks, “I alone, by myself, will bind all sentient beings with the noose of nescience and make them fall into the three miserable realms.”

original: de bcom pas na /
analyzed: de bcom pas na /
translated: Because he destroys that,

original: mi shes dgra'i dregs pa 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes dgra'i dregs pa 'joms pa'o //
translated: he destroys the arrogance of the enemy of nescience.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i g-yul du dpa' ba nyid gang yin zhe na /🔽gang mi shes pa'i dgra'i dregs pa bsal te /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i g-yul du dpa' ba nyid gang yin zhe na / gang mi shes pa'i dgra'i dregs pa bsal te /
translated: Or else, who is the hero in the battle against afflictions?🔽It is he who, having removed the arrogance of the enemy of ignorance,

original: de yang nyon mongs pa rnams shes rab kyi ral gyis mi shes pa'i rgyal po nges par bcom nas /
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa rnams shes rab kyi ral gyis mi shes pa'i rgyal po nges par bcom nas /
translated: with the sword of wisdom, definitely slays the king of ignorance,

original: de'i stobs kyis rnam par rol cing rtsa ba bcad pas gzhan dag kyang bcom par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis rnam par rol cing rtsa ba bcad pas gzhan dag kyang bcom par gyur pa ni /
translated: and through the power of that, having cut the root of the afflictions, he also slays others.

original: nyon mongs g-yul du gcig dpa' ba //
analyzed: nyon mongs g-yul du gcig dpa' ba //
translated: He is the hero in the battle against the afflictions.

original: mi shes dgra yi dregs pa 'joms //
analyzed: mi shes dgra yi dregs pa 'joms //
translated: He is the one who conquers the arrogance of the enemy of ignorance.

original: zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sku dang ldan pa rje btsun 'jam dpal gcig pu nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas de las lhag pa gzhan med par ston nas nyon mongs pa dang bdud dang mu stegs la sogs
analyzed: zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sku dang ldan pa rje btsun 'jam dpal gcig pu nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas de las lhag pa gzhan med par ston nas nyon mongs pa dang bdud dang mu stegs la sogs
translated: The one who possesses the body of wisdom, the venerable Manjusri, is the sole embodiment of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. There is no one superior to him.

original: pa ma lus pa las rnam par rgyal pa'i dga' ston gyi gar gyis 'dul 'gro ba rnams gdul par bya ba'i phyir sgeg pa la sogs pa gar stabs kyi nyams dgu'i khyad par gyis phul du byung bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: pa ma lus pa las rnam par rgyal pa'i dga' ston gyi gar gyis 'dul 'gro ba rnams gdul par bya ba'i phyir sgeg pa la sogs pa gar stabs kyi nyams dgu'i khyad par gyis phul du byung bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is preeminent by the special features of the nine dramatic moods, such as grace, for the sake of disciplining those to be disciplined, he dances the dance of the festival of complete victory over all the demons.

original: dpal ldan blo dang sgeg pa 'chang //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpal ldan blo dang sgeg pa 'chang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is glorious, intelligent, and graceful.🔽He is glorious, intelligent, and graceful.

original: sems can rnams dang cing rjes su chags par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po ni sgeg pa'i gar stabs yin la /🔽shes rab kyang dri ma med cing sems can thams cad kyi sems @243a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang cing rjes su chags par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po ni sgeg pa'i gar stabs yin la / shes rab kyang dri ma med cing sems can thams cad kyi sems @243a * //
translated: The dramatic mood of grace is the very essence of the delight and affection for sentient beings.

original: kyi spyod pa rjes su mkhyen nas rjes su dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis ni sgeg pa'o //
analyzed: kyi spyod pa rjes su mkhyen nas rjes su dga' bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis ni sgeg pa'o //
translated: And wisdom is stainless, and by knowing the mental behavior of all sentient beings, he delights them with the method of his grace.

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na sgeg 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na sgeg 'chang ngo //
translated: He is the bearer of grace because he holds that.

original: glegs bam la la las ni /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni /
translated: In some texts, it says,

original: blo ldan sgeg 'chang dpal ldan zhes zer te /
analyzed: blo ldan sgeg 'chang dpal ldan zhes zer te /
translated: “The intelligent one is glorious and graceful.”

original: der ni bde gshegs dri med pa'i //
analyzed: der ni bde gshegs dri med pa'i //
translated: There, the Sugata is stainless,

original: shes rab rdo rje rnam par bshad //
analyzed: shes rab rdo rje rnam par bshad //
translated: It is the explanation of the vajra of wisdom.

original: ces gsungs pas dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir blo'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pas dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir blo'o //
translated: Thus, it is the mind because it has the nature of stainless wisdom.

original: gal te blo yin na de ni so so rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can gzugs can ma yin pas ji ltar na des sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis gdul la bya'i don rdzogs par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gal te blo yin na de ni so so rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can gzugs can ma yin pas ji ltar na des sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis gdul la bya'i don rdzogs par mdzad ce na /
translated: If it is the mind, it is the nature of self-awareness, and since it is not physical, how does it accomplish the welfare of beings through various forms?

original: 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here it is explained:

original: sems shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid de dang de ra so sor snang ba yin la /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid de dang de ra so sor snang ba yin la /
translated: The mind is the appearance of each individual thing.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal gyis kyang dpal rdo rje snying po'i rgyan gyi rgyud las /
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal gyis kyang dpal rdo rje snying po'i rgyan gyi rgyud las /
translated: The venerable Mañjuśrī also says in the Śrīvajragābha-alamkāra-tantra:🔽Therefore, the stainless wisdom

original: de pas sangs rgyas skyob kun gyi //🔽zag pa med pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de pas sangs rgyas skyob kun gyi // zag pa med pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Of all the buddhas and protectors

original: shes rab dri med bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: shes rab dri med bsam mi khyab //
translated: Is the inconceivable stainless wisdom,

original: sems dpa'i lus su gyur ba yin //
analyzed: sems dpa'i lus su gyur ba yin //
translated: Which becomes the body of the bodhisattvas.

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam dpyad pas //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam dpyad pas //
translated: By analyzing existence and nonexistence,

original: da med sangs rgyas thams cad kyang //
analyzed: da med sangs rgyas thams cad kyang //
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: bdag gi dbang du 'jug gyur pa //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du 'jug gyur pa //
translated: Are brought under my control.

original: ae ma'o chos nyid bsam mi khyab //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ae ma'o chos nyid bsam mi khyab // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ah! The nature of things is inconceivable!

original: de bas sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams dang shin tu ldan pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pas na dus thams cad du ma tshang pa med pas sems can gyi don rgyas par mdzad pa yin no //🔽des na / blo ldan sgeg 'chang dpal dang ldan //
analyzed: de bas sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams dang shin tu ldan pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pas na dus thams cad du ma tshang pa med pas sems can gyi don rgyas par mdzad pa yin no // des na / blo ldan sgeg 'chang dpal dang ldan //
translated: Thus, because the various forms endowed with the moods of grace, etc., are completely effective for the sake of the beings to be trained, they are always complete and so they are always effective for the sake of beings.

original: zhes zer ba'i tshig shin tu rigs pa yin no //🔽bdud la sogs pa'i dgra nges par bzlog cing 'jigs pa mi mnga' ba'i gzugs mod la 'dzin par mdzad pas na brtan pa'i gzugs 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i tshig shin tu rigs pa yin no // bdud la sogs pa'i dgra nges par bzlog cing 'jigs pa mi mnga' ba'i gzugs mod la 'dzin par mdzad pas na brtan pa'i gzugs 'chang ba'o //
translated: Thus, the statement, “The wise one is endowed with the glory of grace,” is quite reasonable.🔽He is the bearer of the form of the steadfast, because he immediately assumes a form that is fearless and certain to ward off the enemies such as Mara.

original: shin tu drag cing mi bzad pa 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na mi sdug gzugs can 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu drag cing mi bzad pa 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na mi sdug gzugs can 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the bearer of the form of the ugly, because he assumes a form that is extremely fierce and terrifying.

original: de yang sgeg pa dang / dpa' ba dang / mi sdug pa dang / dgong ba dang / rngam pa dang / snying rje dang / 'jigs su rung ba dang / zhi ba dang / rmad du byung ba'i gar gyi bye brag gis kun du spyod cing smin ma'i khro gnyer dang /
analyzed: de yang sgeg pa dang / dpa' ba dang / mi sdug pa dang / dgong ba dang / rngam pa dang / snying rje dang / 'jigs su rung ba dang / zhi ba dang / rmad du byung ba'i gar gyi bye brag gis kun du spyod cing smin ma'i khro gnyer dang /
translated: Moreover, with the distinctions of the dance of charm, heroism, ugliness, laughter, wrath, compassion, fearfulness, peace, and wonder, with the dance of the eyebrows knitted in anger,

original: spyan 'bar bar snang zhing zhal gyi dbyibs du ma rnams dang / mtshon cha sna tshogs pa bsnams pas gtum pa'i lag pa brgya po gar gyi rnam pa'i bya ba sna tshogs par gzhag pa'i zhabs brgya rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams thams @243b cad khyab cing sku dang /
analyzed: spyan 'bar bar snang zhing zhal gyi dbyibs du ma rnams dang / mtshon cha sna tshogs pa bsnams pas gtum pa'i lag pa brgya po gar gyi rnam pa'i bya ba sna tshogs par gzhag pa'i zhabs brgya rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams thams @243b cad khyab cing sku dang /
translated: with the eyes blazing, with the many shapes of the face, and with the various weapons held in the hundred fierce hands, with the hundred feet placed in the various actions of the dance, the whole realm of space is pervaded by the body,

original: phyag dang zhabs kyis khyab pa'i rnam par rol pa rnams kyis gar mdzad cing sgyu 'phrul chen po'i gar gyi dbang phyug tu gyur ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyis khyab pa'i rnam par rol pa rnams kyis gar mdzad cing sgyu 'phrul chen po'i gar gyi dbang phyug tu gyur ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and with the play of the pervasion of the body, hands, and feet, the dance is performed. The one who is the lord of the great magic dance is the Bhagavat himself.

original: lag pa brgya po kun bskyod cing //
analyzed: lag pa brgya po kun bskyod cing //
translated: All the hundred hands are moved.

original: gom pa'i stabs kyis gar byed pa //
analyzed: gom pa'i stabs kyis gar byed pa //
translated: and dancing with the gait of a goose.

original: dpal ldan lag pa brgyas gang la //
analyzed: dpal ldan lag pa brgyas gang la //
translated: In the glorious one with a hundred hands,

original: nam mkha' khyab par gar byed pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' khyab par gar byed pa //

analyzed: kha nang du bltas par 'jug cing bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams la thar par 'du shes pa rnams las bzlog pa'i phyir khams gnyis las byung ba'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so // srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa las 'das par gyur pas na //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the passion of existence is the passion that arises from the two realms, because it is the opposite of the passion that turns inward, and of the notion that the meditative absorptions and formless states are liberation.🔽He has gone beyond the passion of existence and so on.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags sogs spangs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags sogs spangs pa'o //
translated: He has abandoned the passion of existence and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bzung ste /
translated: The word “and so on” includes the passion of desire.

original: 'dod pa rnams la chags pas na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la chags pas na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: It is attachment to the desire realm because of attachment to the desires.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags sogs spangs pa //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags sogs spangs pa //
translated: he is free from attachment to existence and so forth.

original: zhes bya'o // chos thams cad stong pa nyid du thugs su chud pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par nye bar dmigs pa'i 'dod chags de dag dang bral du zin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // chos thams cad stong pa nyid du thugs su chud pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par nye bar dmigs pa'i 'dod chags de dag dang bral du zin kyang /
translated: Even though he is free from those attachments that are focused on the desire, form, and formless realms because he has realized that all phenomena are emptiness,

original: thugs rje chen pos sring pa gsum du skyes pa'i sems can rnams /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos sring pa gsum du skyes pa'i sems can rnams /
translated: he is pleased to rescue sentient beings who are born in the three realms

original: gdon par bya ba la mngon par dgyes pas na /
analyzed: gdon par bya ba la mngon par dgyes pas na /
translated: through his great compassion.🔽Thus,

original: srid gsum dga' ba chen po ba //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: srid gsum dga' ba chen po ba // zhes bya ste /
translated: he is the one with great delight in the three realms.🔽He is the one who has great delight in the three realms.

original: sring pa gsum la dga' ba chen po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces ni kha dog gzhan dag dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: sring pa gsum la dga' ba chen po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces ni kha dog gzhan dag dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is not mixed with other colors.🔽Thus,

original: de ltar na sprin nas //
analyzed: de ltar na sprin nas //
translated: he is like a white cloud.

original: bcom ldan 'das shin tu yang mdangs dang gzi brjid nyid dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shin tu yang mdangs dang gzi brjid nyid dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the Bhagavān endowed with radiance and splendor,

original: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
analyzed: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
translated: he is white like a pure white cloud.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sprin ni chu 'dzin no //
analyzed: sprin ni chu 'dzin no //
translated: A cloud is a water-bearer.

original: dkar ba ni shin tu yang dkar pa'o //
analyzed: dkar ba ni shin tu yang dkar pa'o //
translated: White is very white.

original: dag pa ni kha dog gzhan dag dang ma 'dres pa'o //🔽de ltar na sprin dkar po dag pa bzhin du dkar ba la ni /
analyzed: dag pa ni kha dog gzhan dag dang ma 'dres pa'o // de ltar na sprin dkar po dag pa bzhin du dkar ba la ni /
translated: Pure is unmixed with other colors.🔽Thus, like a white, pure cloud,

original: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
analyzed: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
translated: it is white like a white, pure cloud.

original: zhes bya'o // dang zhing bsil la 'gro ba rnams tshim par byed pa'i 'od zer dkar po dpag tu med pa mnga' bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dang zhing bsil la 'gro ba rnams tshim par byed pa'i 'od zer dkar po dpag tu med pa mnga' bas na /
translated: It has immeasurable white light rays that are pure, cool, and satisfy beings,

original: 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
analyzed: 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
translated: so it is well-illuminated like the light of an autumn moon.

original: ces bya'o // thugs rje chen po'i chags pas dmar ba'i sen mo mda' bas na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // thugs rje chen po'i chags pas dmar ba'i sen mo mda' bas na /
translated: Its nails are red with the passion of great compassion, so

original: se na mo'i 'od ni shas cher dmar //
analyzed: se na mo'i 'od ni shas cher dmar //
translated: the light of the nails is very red.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid kyis na /🔽nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil 'khor ltar mdzes //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid kyis na / nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil 'khor ltar mdzes //
translated: And because of that,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is beautiful like the orb of the rising sun.

original: dang po 'char ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil @245b 'khor gyi mdangs ltar dmar ba'i 'od gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dang po 'char ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil @245b 'khor gyi mdangs ltar dmar ba'i 'od gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is red like the radiance of the orb of the rising sun.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sku dang ldan pas //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sku dang ldan pas //
translated: Because he possesses a body that is the nature of completely pure wisdom,

original: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
analyzed: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //
translated: he is white like a pure white cloud.

original: zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi 'od zer 'phro bas rnam par mdzes pa'i 'od mnga' bas na 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od do //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi 'od zer 'phro bas rnam par mdzes pa'i 'od mnga' bas na 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od do //
translated: Because he is beautiful with the light rays of wisdom shining forth, he is the light of the autumn moon with excellent light.

original: thugs rje chen po'i chags pa'i mdangs kyis phyi rol du snang ba'i 'od dang ldan pa'i sku mnga' bas na /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i chags pa'i mdangs kyis phyi rol du snang ba'i 'od dang ldan pa'i sku mnga' bas na /
translated: Because he possesses a body that has light shining forth externally with the radiance of attachment to great compassion,

original: nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar mdzes //🔽sen mo'i 'od ni shas cher dmar //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar mdzes // sen mo'i 'od ni shas cher dmar //
translated: he is beautiful like the rising orb of the sun.🔽The light of his nails is extremely red.

original: zhes bya'o // rin po che mthon ka'i rtse mo'i 'od kyi chogs khyab dog sngo ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rin po che mthon ka'i rtse mo'i 'od kyi chogs khyab dog sngo ba ste /
translated: The light of the peak of the sapphire is blue and extensive.

original: mthon ka'i rtse ltar bzang zhing mdzes pa'i zur phud lnga gang la mnga' ba de ni /
analyzed: mthon ka'i rtse ltar bzang zhing mdzes pa'i zur phud lnga gang la mnga' ba de ni /
translated: He who possesses five locks of hair that are beautiful and attractive like the peak of a sapphire,

original: cod pan bzang po mthon ka'i rtse //
analyzed: cod pan bzang po mthon ka'i rtse //
translated: he is the excellent crown of the peak of the sapphire.

original: zhes bya'o // skar rnams kyi mchog ni mchog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // skar rnams kyi mchog ni mchog ste /
translated: The best of the stars is the best.

original: skra gzhan las thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba'i don to //🔽mthon ka chen po ltar shin tu sngo ba'i skra'i mchog 'chang bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: skra gzhan las thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba'i don to // mthon ka chen po ltar shin tu sngo ba'i skra'i mchog 'chang bar mdzad pas na /
translated: The meaning of the word “crest” is “the best of all.🔽” He is the one who bears the crest of hair that is the best of all, like a great sapphire.

original: skra mchog mthon ka chen po can //
analyzed: skra mchog mthon ka chen po can //
translated: He is the one who has the crest of hair that is like a great sapphire.

original: zhes bya'o // mthon ka dang mthon ka chen po'i dbye ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mthon ka dang mthon ka chen po'i dbye ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between a sapphire and a great sapphire is this.

original: mthon ka ni cung zad sdo ste /
analyzed: mthon ka ni cung zad sdo ste /
translated: A sapphire is slightly blue.

original: cung zad dmar ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: cung zad dmar ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a slight redness.

original: de nyid shin tu shas cher sngo ba ni mthon ka chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid shin tu shas cher sngo ba ni mthon ka chen po ste /
translated: A great sapphire is a very intense blue.

original: rigs kyi bye brag yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference in their species.

original: nor bu chen po ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang dag par rdzogs par mdzad pa la gzhol pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu chen po ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang dag par rdzogs par mdzad pa la gzhol pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bya'o //
translated: A great jewel is the Blessed Buddha, because he is intent on perfectly fulfilling the aims of all beings without exception.

original: de rnams kyi 'od chags pa ni kha dog sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i 'od zer rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'od chags pa ni kha dog sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i 'od zer rnams te /
translated: The radiance of those is the light of the emanations of various colors.

original: 'od zer de rnams kyis mdzes pa'i dpal gang la yod pa de ni /
analyzed: 'od zer de rnams kyis mdzes pa'i dpal gang la yod pa de ni /
translated: The one who has the glory of that light is🔽.

original: nor bu chen po'i 'od chags dpal //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nor bu chen po'i 'od chags dpal // zhes bya ste /
translated: The light of the Great Jewel, the glory.

original: gang gi phyir mdog sna tshogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon par byed pa ni /🔽sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdog sna tshogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon par byed pa ni / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //
translated: Because it outshines all the ornaments of the various colors of the Asramas.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: 6. The Buddha is adorned with the ornament of emanations.

original: shin tu yang legs par brgyan par byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: shin tu yang legs par brgyan par byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: He is well adorned indeed.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa //
translated: 7. He shakes a hundred world-realms.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He has the great power of the bases of magical powers.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: Here, the bases of magical powers are four.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽'od lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / 'od lta ste /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'o //
translated: They are will, effort, thought, and investigation.

original: de rnams kyi rtsa ba dang gzhi dang gnas ni byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtsa ba dang gzhi dang gnas ni byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //
translated: Their root, basis, and foundation are loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de tshad med @246a * //
analyzed: de tshad med @246a * //
translated: They are immeasurable.

original: pa bzhi po 'di bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pas sems las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa bzhi po 'di bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pas sems las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating and frequently practicing these four bases of supernormal power, one attains mental flexibility.

original: de sems las su rung ba thob pas bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de sems las su rung ba thob pas bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: Having attained mental flexibility, one enters and abides in the first concentration.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa la yang mnyam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa la yang mnyam par 'jog ste /
translated: Similarly, one enters and abides in the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration.

original: de bsam gtan thob pas lus dang sems yang ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsam gtan thob pas lus dang sems yang ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the concentrations, one attains lightness of body and mind.

original: de lus dang sems yang ba dang ldan pas mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de lus dang sems yang ba dang ldan pas mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: Endowed with lightness of body and mind, one accomplishes the entry into supernormal knowledge.

original: de mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa dang ldan pas 'dun pa las sam /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa dang ldan pas 'dun pa las sam /
translated: Endowed with the accomplishment of the entry into supernormal knowledge, one generates the supernormal power that comes from aspiration,

original: sems las sam /
analyzed: sems las sam /
translated: from thought,

original: dpyod pa las rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bskyed do //🔽de la 'dun pa ni gang chos de dag la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa las rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bskyed do // de la 'dun pa ni gang chos de dag la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: and from analysis.🔽Here, aspiration is the orientation toward those qualities.

original: de la brtson 'grus ni gang chos de dag sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus ni gang chos de dag sgrub pa'o //
translated: Here, effort is the accomplishment of those qualities.

original: sems kyis ni gang chos de dag rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis ni gang chos de dag rtog pa'o //
translated: The mind is that which conceives of those phenomena.

original: dpyod pa ni gang chos de dag la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni gang chos de dag la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Discernment is that which is skilled in those phenomena.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon par 'grub pa rnams kyis yang dag par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon par 'grub pa rnams kyis yang dag par 'grub pa ste /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the bases of supernatural powers.

original: de'i phyir na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the bases of supernatural powers.

original: de la 'dun pas ni rnam par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pas ni rnam par sgrub pa'o //
translated: Among them, aspiration is the accomplishment.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the completion.

original: sems kyis ni rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: sems kyis ni rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The mind is the establishment.

original: dpyod pas ni rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: dpyod pas ni rnam par 'byed do //
translated: Discernment is the analysis.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni mos pa las byung ba /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni mos pa las byung ba /
translated: Among them, the bodhisattvas’ bases of supernatural powers are born of aspiration,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa /
translated: are free of fabrication,

original: rang gi sems bskyed pas dbang byed pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems bskyed pas dbang byed pa /
translated: are controlled by the generation of their own minds,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba //🔽yongs su sbyang ba legs par byas pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba // yongs su sbyang ba legs par byas pa /
translated: and go wherever they wish.🔽They are well-purified,

original: rtsa ba la shin tu gnas pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba la shin tu gnas pa /
translated: and are well-established in the root.

original: thams cad du rgyu zhing rlung dmar bzhin du thogs pa med pa nam mkha'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu zhing rlung dmar bzhin du thogs pa med pa nam mkha'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: They move everywhere, unimpeded like the wind, to the end of space.🔽Venerable

original: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa gnon par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa gnon par mdzad pas na /
translated: Subhūti, these are the bodhisattvas’ four bases of miraculous powers, which are inexhaustible.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa //
translated: They shake a hundred worlds.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //
translated: They have the great power of the bases of miraculous powers.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This is what it says.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam yin gyi /
translated: “A hundred worlds” is just a rough illustration.

original: gzhan du na sa dang po nyid la 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa yin pas phul du byung ba ci zhig yod par bshad pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan du na sa dang po nyid la 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa yin pas phul du byung ba ci zhig yod par bshad pa yin /
translated: Otherwise, what is so special about shaking a hundred worlds on the first level?

original: de yang sa bcu pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang sa bcu pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra of the Ten Levels says:

original: sa'i rgya cher gsungs nas nye bar bsdu ba'i tshul gyis gsungs pa ji ltar @246b 'dod pa de lta bu'i gzugs dang / brtson 'grus ji lta bu dag rtsom zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i rgya cher gsungs nas nye bar bsdu ba'i tshul gyis gsungs pa ji ltar @246b 'dod pa de lta bu'i gzugs dang / brtson 'grus ji lta bu dag rtsom zhe na /
translated: What kind of form and diligence should one practice?

original: de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig la khyim dang chung ma dang rgya la sring thams cad yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig la khyim dang chung ma dang rgya la sring thams cad yongs su spangs te /
translated: If one wishes, in a single instant one can abandon one’s home, spouse, and retinue,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dang rab tu byung nas kyang skar cig yud tsam thang cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob cing snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dang rab tu byung nas kyang skar cig yud tsam thang cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob cing snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
translated: and go forth in the teachings of the Tathāgata. Having gone forth, in a single instant one can attain and enter a hundred meditative absorptions, see a hundred buddhas, understand those buddhas’ blessings,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya bskyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyar 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar bya ba dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa brgyar gnas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya bskyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyar 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar bya ba dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa brgyar gnas par bya ba dang /
translated: They shake a hundred world systems, go to a hundred buddhafields, illuminate a hundred world systems, bring a hundred beings to spiritual maturity, remain for a hundred eons,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' bskal pa brgya la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' bskal pa brgya la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
translated: penetrate a hundred eons past and future, open a hundred Dharma doors, manifest a hundred bodies, and in each body manifest a hundred bodhisattvas.
