translated: The bodhisattva who feels like this does not see a feeler.

original: de mi mthong bas tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de mi mthong bas tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Not seeing that, he does not see feeling.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dus byas thams cad ni tshor ba bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dus byas thams cad ni tshor ba bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The Lord has said that all conditioned things are feeling.

original: gal te 'dus byas thams cad tshor ba yin na ni 'di la tshor ba bo zhes bya ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas thams cad tshor ba yin na ni 'di la tshor ba bo zhes bya ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If all conditioned things are feeling, what is there that is called a feeler?

original: tshor ba ni tshor bar byed pa ma yin tshor ba dang tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ni tshor bar byed pa ma yin tshor ba dang tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: Feeling is not a feeler, nor is it not a feeler.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus byas tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus byas tshor bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: The unconditioned does not feel the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas las rnam par grol ba'i tshor bar byed pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas las rnam par grol ba'i tshor bar byed pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is no feeler that is free from the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de ltar tsher ba de dag tshor ba med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar tsher ba de dag tshor ba med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, he sees that all feelings are devoid of feeling.

original: 'di la tshor ba la rtsol ba gang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di la tshor ba la rtsol ba gang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any effort in feeling.

original: byang chub ji ltar tshor ba yang de bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor @248b ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub ji ltar tshor ba yang de bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor @248b ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He sees awakening just as he sees feeling. This is called the bodhisatvas’ application of mindfulness to feeling.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisatvas’ application of mindfulness to mind consist in?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here the bodhisatvas think as follows:

original: gang tshor ba de ni sems tsam mo //
analyzed: gang tshor ba de ni sems tsam mo //
translated: ‘Whatever is feeling is simply mind.’

original: sems de yang gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: sems de yang gnas pa med pa /
translated: That mind is also without abode.

original: gzung du med pa /
analyzed: gzung du med pa /
translated: It is ungraspable.

original: lus med pa'o //🔽gang gnas med pa /
analyzed: lus med pa'o // gang gnas med pa /
translated: It is without a body.

original: lus med pa de'i gnas ji lta bu zhig yod snyam mo//
analyzed: lus med pa de'i gnas ji lta bu zhig yod snyam mo//
translated: What kind of abode could there be for that which has no abode and no body?

original: sems kyis sems mi shes so //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi shes so //
translated: The mind does not know the mind.

original: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
translated: The mind does not see the mind.

original: gang la brten nas 'byung ba'i sems de yang gzhan rag las pa rang dbang med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la brten nas 'byung ba'i sems de yang gzhan rag las pa rang dbang med par mthong ngo //
translated: One sees that the mind that arises in dependence on something else is powerless, lacking independence.

original: sems ma rtog bar byang chub kyang mi shes so //
analyzed: sems ma rtog bar byang chub kyang mi shes so //
translated: Without realizing the mind, awakening is not known.

original: de byang chub sems tsam du shes pas sems la dbang thob bo //
analyzed: de byang chub sems tsam du shes pas sems la dbang thob bo //
translated: Through knowing the mind to be just the mind, one gains power over the mind.

original: de sems la dbang bas theg pa chen po la dbang byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la yang sems snyoms pa dang / theg pa chen po la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: de sems la dbang bas theg pa chen po la dbang byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la yang sems snyoms pa dang / theg pa chen po la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Through having power over the mind, one gains power over the Great Vehicle, one’s mind becomes impartial toward all sentient beings, and one does not rely on others with regard to the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems dran pa nya bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems dran pa nya bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness of the mind.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness of phenomena consist in?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'am /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'am /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas are mindful of any virtuous or

original: mi dge ba 'am /🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa 'am /🔽kha na ma tho ba med pa 'am /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba 'am / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa 'am / kha na ma tho ba med pa 'am / zag pa dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: nonvirtuous phenomena,🔽those that are reprehensible or irreproachable,

original: zag pa med pa 'am /🔽'jig rten pa 'am /
analyzed: zag pa med pa 'am / 'jig rten pa 'am /
translated: those that are contaminated or uncontaminated,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'am /
translated: those that are mundane or supramundane,

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: those that are śrāvaka phenomena,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: those that are pratyekabuddha phenomena,🔽those that are ordinary beings’ phenomena,

original: so so skye bo'i chos sam /
analyzed: so so skye bo'i chos sam /
translated: or any other phenomena.🔽They are mindful of all phenomena in this way.

original: chos gang dang gang la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i chos te /
analyzed: chos gang dang gang la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i chos te /
translated: They are mindful of phenomena that are well grasped,

original: shin tu gzung ba /🔽shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa /
analyzed: shin tu gzung ba / shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa /
translated: well purified,🔽well accumulated,

original: shin tu bsags pa /🔽shin tu byang chub pa rang gi kha na las pa /
analyzed: shin tu bsags pa / shin tu byang chub pa rang gi kha na las pa /
translated: and well awakened to.

original: shin tu dbang med pa'i dran pa des /
analyzed: shin tu dbang med pa'i dran pa des /
translated: With such mindfulness, which is independent of others and autonomous,

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa mnyam par byed de /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa mnyam par byed de /
translated: they make the unborn and unceasing equal.

original: gang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / gang rten cing 'brel par 'gyung ba las rnam par grol ba dang / gang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa las rnam par grol ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / gang rten cing 'brel par 'gyung ba las rnam par grol ba dang / gang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa las rnam par grol ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any dharma that is not born and does not cease, that is liberated from dependent origination, that is liberated from emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks like this:

original: chos thams cad bdag po med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag po med pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are without a master.

original: dben pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: dben pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: They have the nature of being isolated.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag gi ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag gi ba med pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are without a self.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: They have the nature of nonduality.

original: chos thams cad ni sgrib pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sgrib pa med pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are unobstructed.

original: nam mkha'i rnag bzhin can /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rnag bzhin can /
translated: They have the nature of space.

original: chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /🔽sems @249a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste / sems @249a * //
translated: All dharmas are nonconceptual.🔽They are free from mind,

original: dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
translated: mentality, and consciousness.

original: chos thams cad ni rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: All dharmas are by nature liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: They have the nature of being without afflictions.

original: chos thams cad ni smra ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smra ba med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are inexpressible,

original: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: having the nature of being inexpressible.

original: chos thams cad ni yi ge med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yi ge med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are without syllables,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: having the nature of being unconditioned.

original: chos thams cad ni grangs med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni grangs med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are beyond number,

original: grangs thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: grangs thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: transcending all numbers.

original: chos thams cad ni drang ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni drang ba med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are not straight,

original: spros pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: transcending all conceptual elaborations.

original: chos thams cad ni sa bon med pa'i phyir rtsa ba med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sa bon med pa'i phyir rtsa ba med pa /
translated: All phenomena are rootless, because they are without seed.

original: chos thams cad ni rtsa ba rnam par byang ba'i phyir skyon med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rtsa ba rnam par byang ba'i phyir skyon med pa /
translated: All phenomena are faultless, because their roots are purified.

original: chos thams cad ni lus med pa'i phyir 'od ba med pa //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni lus med pa'i phyir 'od ba med pa //
translated: All phenomena are without light, because they are bodiless.

original: chos thams cad ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir song ba med pa /🔽chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi stong ba'i phyir chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir song ba med pa / chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi stong ba'i phyir chags pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without going, because they are without abode.🔽All phenomena are without attachment, because they are empty by nature.

original: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir stong pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir stong pa /
translated: All phenomena are empty, because they are dependently originated.

original: chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir nges par byung ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir nges par byung ba /
translated: All phenomena are beyond conceptualization.

original: chos thams cad ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin khong du chud pa'i phyir rang gi kha na las pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin khong du chud pa'i phyir rang gi kha na las pa /
translated: All phenomena are self-originated, as they are understood according to one’s wishes.

original: chos thams cad ni shes bya'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir byang chub pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shes bya'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir byang chub pa /
translated: All phenomena are awakened, as they are the nature of the knowable.

original: chos thams cad ni rdzas med pa'i phyir ming tsam pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rdzas med pa'i phyir ming tsam pa /
translated: All phenomena are mere names, as they are not substantial.

original: chos thams cad ni bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir lta ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir lta ba dang bral ba /
translated: All phenomena are free from views, as they are not an essence that can be demonstrated.

original: chos thams cad ni lus pa med pa'i phyir bcings pa med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni lus pa med pa'i phyir bcings pa med pa /
translated: All phenomena are unfettered, as they are not incomplete.

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir grol ba med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir grol ba med pa /
translated: All phenomena are liberated, as they are not an essence.

original: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir thibs po med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir thibs po med pa /
translated: All phenomena are not dense, as they are the essence of suchness.

original: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir dbyings gcig pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir dbyings gcig pa /
translated: All phenomena are of one basic space, as they are inseparable from the basic space of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir tha mi dang do snyam du de nyid chos la chos kyi dbyings su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir tha mi dang do snyam du de nyid chos la chos kyi dbyings su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: In this way, he views phenomena as the realm of phenomena and abides in that.

original: de ltar chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can du mi byed /
analyzed: de ltar chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can du mi byed /
translated: The bodhisattva who views phenomena as phenomena and abides in that does not make sentient beings.

original: theg pa tha dad du mi byed /
analyzed: theg pa tha dad du mi byed /
translated: He does not make different vehicles.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad du mi byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad du mi byed /
translated: He does not make different buddhafields.

original: tha ma dang / mchog dang / bcings pa dang / thar pa dang ; 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽spong ba med 'dzin pa med /🔽'jug pa med /
analyzed: tha ma dang / mchog dang / bcings pa dang / thar pa dang ; 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / spong ba med 'dzin pa med / 'jug pa med /
translated: He does not see the end or the beginning, the bound or the liberated, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.🔽He does not abandon or grasp.

original: ldog pa med /🔽len pa med /
analyzed: ldog pa med / len pa med /
translated: He does not engage or disengage.

original: dor ba med /
analyzed: dor ba med /
translated: He does not take up or put down.

original: mi g-yo ba mthong zhing gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba mthong zhing gnas pa yin te /
translated: He sees and abides in the unmoving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba la gnas bde sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa na @249b gnas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzigs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba la gnas bde sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa na @249b gnas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzigs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston te /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Śāntamati, who was dwelling in a different buddhafield, was seen by the blessed buddhas and prophesied to attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas rjes rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas rjes rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom ste /
translated: “What, you may wonder, is the bodhisattvas’ application of mindfulness to the Buddha?

original: sems can thams cad mngon du byas nas bdag kyang sems can thams cad kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par sgrub po //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mngon du byas nas bdag kyang sems can thams cad kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par sgrub po //
translated: Here, bodhisattvas cultivate the application of mindfulness to the Buddha by bringing all sentient beings to mind and thinking, ‘I will attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
translated: In this way, he establishes mindfulness, thinking, “I will accomplish the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly awakened ones, the four forms of fearlessness, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.”

original: dran pa des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dran pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: dran pa des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dran pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: Through that mindfulness, he attains the inconceivable mindfulness of the blessed buddhas,

original: dri ma med pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa /
translated: which is stainless,

original: rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa /
translated: pure,

original: 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba /
translated: luminous,

original: bag la nyal med pa /
analyzed: bag la nyal med pa /
translated: free of latent tendencies,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa thams cad yang dag bar chad pa /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa thams cad yang dag bar chad pa /
translated: and has completely severed all the connections of habitual tendencies.

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba /
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba /
translated: It is preceded by wisdom,

original: ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa /
translated: is governed by wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang du gyur ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang du gyur ba /
translated: is governed by all the buddhas,

original: chos kyi dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du gyur pa /
translated: is governed by the Dharma,

original: lha'i dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbang du gyur pa /
translated: is governed by the gods,

original: nges par gyur pa thams cad thob pa /
analyzed: nges par gyur pa thams cad thob pa /
translated: and has attained all the certainties.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma med pa /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma med pa /
translated: It is stainless with regard to the obscurations of the knowable.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi rtogs pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi rtogs pa /
translated: It is not realized by any of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: It is naturally nonconceptual.

original: lhun gyis grub pa /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa /
translated: It is spontaneously present.

original: mthu sgrib pa med pa /
analyzed: mthu sgrib pa med pa /
translated: It is unobstructed power.

original: thogs pa med par gnas pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med par gnas pa /
translated: It is unobstructed abiding.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rgyas par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rgyas par byed pa /
translated: It fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: nam mkha' ltar 'gyur ba med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rjes su dran pa de dag rjes su dran no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar 'gyur ba med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rjes su dran pa de dag rjes su dran no //
translated: It is the buddha mindfulness that is unchanging like space.

original: dran pa rin po che sangs rgyas rnams kyi nor /
analyzed: dran pa rin po che sangs rgyas rnams kyi nor /
translated: The precious mindfulness is the wealth of the buddhas.🔽It is the treasure of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzod de dag rjes su dran te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzod de dag rjes su dran te /
translated: It is the mindfulness of those.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the mindfulness of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas ni dran pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni dran pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Buddha is not mindfulness.🔽He is not nonmindfulness.

original: mi dran pa yang ma yin par thams cad du lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i dran pa de dag rjes su dran te //
analyzed: mi dran pa yang ma yin par thams cad du lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i dran pa de dag rjes su dran te //
translated: It is the mindfulness of those who are spontaneously present and nonconceptual in every way.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: chos la rton pa /

analyzed: chos kyis rnyed pa /

original: chos kyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis grub pa'o //

analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang chos las skyes pa /

original: chos kyis rnyed pa /
analyzed: chos kyis rnyed pa /

original: chos kyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis grub pa'o //

analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde pa yod pa de dag kyang chos las skyes pa /

original: chos kyis rnyed pa /
analyzed: chos kyis rnyed pa /
translated: It is gained through the Dharma.

original: chos kyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis grub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished through the Dharma.

translated: The Dharma is impartial toward all sentient beings. The Dharma does not engage with them based on whether they are inferior, middling, or superior.

analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o // chos ni phyogs su ma lhung ba /
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind like the Dharma.🔽The Dharma is not partial.

original: chos ni dor lta zhing 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni dor lta zhing 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma does not engage in rejecting or adopting.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

analyzed: chos ni dus chad pa med pa 'di mthong la don yod pa rang gis rig pas chos ni dus la lta zhing 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma is not concerned with time, for it is seen to be timeless, and its meaning is realized by oneself.

analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o // chos ni mthon dman pas chos ni rgya che ba la 'jug pa ma yin /
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: dman pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dman pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma does not engage in the vast, nor does it engage in the inferior.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang mthun pa'i sems su bya'o //🔽chos ni mchog dang tha ma dang brlas bas chos ni rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang mthun pa'i sems su bya'o // chos ni mchog dang tha ma dang brlas bas chos ni rnam par dag pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin /
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: nyams pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma does not engage in purity, nor does it engage in degeneration.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind like the Dharma.🔽The Dharma does not engage in the supreme, nor does it engage in the inferior.

original: chos ni zhing dang zhing ma yin pa'i lta ba dang bral bas chos ni 'phags pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos ni zhing dang zhing ma yin pa'i lta ba dang bral bas chos ni 'phags pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Dharma is free from the views of being a field and not being a field. The Dharma does not engage with the noble ones,

original: so so'i skye bo la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor does it engage with ordinary beings.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang @251b chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang @251b chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In this way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni rtag pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas chos ni nyin mo 'jug pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos ni rtag pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas chos ni nyin mo 'jug pa ma yin /
translated: The Dharma is uninterrupted and continuous. The Dharma does not engage during the day

original: mtshan mo 'jug pa ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan mo 'jug pa ma yin /
translated: and not engage at night.

original: mtshan mo 'jug la nyin mo mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan mo 'jug la nyin mo mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not engage at night and not engage during the day.

original: de ltar na bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In this way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni gang la yang nam yang sdod pa ma yin pas chos ni 'dul ba'i chos las kyang mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: chos ni gang la yang nam yang sdod pa ma yin pas chos ni 'dul ba'i chos las kyang mi 'da' ste /
translated: The Dharma never stops for anyone. The Dharma does not transgress the Dharma of the Vinaya.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In this way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni thams cad du 'dod pa med pas chos ni snang pa thams cad la zhe 'gras pa yang med /
analyzed: chos ni thams cad du 'dod pa med pas chos ni snang pa thams cad la zhe 'gras pa yang med /
translated: The Dharma is free from desire in all regards. The Dharma is not averse to any appearances.

original: dad pa rnams la rjes su chags pa yang med de /
analyzed: dad pa rnams la rjes su chags pa yang med de /
translated: He is not attached to those who have faith.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I will have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni bri ba yang ma yin gang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni bri ba yang ma yin gang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma is not diminished or filled up.

original: dpag tu med pa grangs med pas nam mkha' ltar bri ba yang ma yin 'phel ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa grangs med pas nam mkha' ltar bri ba yang ma yin 'phel ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not diminished or increased like space, which is immeasurable and incalculable.

original: de ltar na bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //🔽chos ni sems can rnams kyis bsrung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o // chos ni sems can rnams kyis bsrung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, I will have a mind that is like the Dharma.🔽The Dharma is not protected by sentient beings.

original: chos kyis sems can rnams bsrung ste ;
analyzed: chos kyis sems can rnams bsrung ste ;
translated: Sentient beings are protected by the Dharma.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra pa'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra pa'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I will have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni skyabs yongs su tshol ba ma yin pas //
analyzed: chos ni skyabs yongs su tshol ba ma yin pas //
translated: The Dharma does not seek refuge.

original: chos ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi skyabs yin te /
analyzed: chos ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi skyabs yin te /
translated: The Dharma is the refuge for the whole world.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I will have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas chos ni gang la yang thogs pa med de ;
analyzed: chos ni thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas chos ni gang la yang thogs pa med de ;
translated: The Dharma has the characteristic of being unobstructed. The Dharma is not obstructed by anything.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: chos ni bag la nyal la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos ni bag la nyal la mi 'jug ste /
translated: The Dharma does not engage in latent tendencies.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: chos ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pas chos ni 'khor pas 'jigs skrag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pas chos ni 'khor pas 'jigs skrag pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Dharma is always nonconceptual. The Dharma is not frightened by cyclic existence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not attached to nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos la par dran pa nye bar 'jog pas de'i phyir chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos la par dran pa nye bar 'jog pas de'i phyir chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, since bodhisattvas establish the close placement of mindfulness in a way that is similar to the Dharma, it is called the recollection of the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhas bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhas bya'o //
translated: Noble son, this is the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of the Saṅgha?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva should think,

original: dge 'dun ni chos smra ba /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni chos smra ba /
translated: “The Saṅgha is the one who teaches the Dharma,

original: chos spyod pa /
analyzed: chos spyod pa /
translated: the one who practices the Dharma,

original: chos sems pa /
analyzed: chos sems pa /
translated: the one who contemplates the Dharma,

original: chos kyi zhing /
analyzed: chos kyi zhing /
translated: the field of the Dharma,

original: chos 'dzin pa chos la rton pa /
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa chos la rton pa /
translated: the one who upholds the Dharma, the one who relies on the Dharma,

original: chos la mchod pa /🔽chos kyi bya ba byed pa /
analyzed: chos la mchod pa / chos kyi bya ba byed pa /
translated: the one who makes offerings to the Dharma,

original: chos @252a * //🔽spyod yul pa /
analyzed: chos @252a * // spyod yul pa /
translated: the one who performs the activities of the Dharma,🔽the one who has the Dharma as his domain,

original: chos spyod pa /
analyzed: chos spyod pa /
translated: the one who practices the Dharma,

original: phun sum tshogs pa /🔽rang bzhin gyis drang pa /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa / rang bzhin gyis drang pa /
translated: the one who is perfect,🔽the one who is naturally upright,

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa /
translated: the one who is naturally pure,

original: snying rje'i chos can /
analyzed: snying rje'i chos can /
translated: the one who has compassion as his Dharma,

original: snying rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa /
translated: the one who is endowed with compassion,

original: rtag tu dpen pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rtag tu dpen pa la spyod pa /
translated: the one who always practices in solitude,

original: rtag tu chos la gzhol pa /
analyzed: rtag tu chos la gzhol pa /
translated: the one who always applies himself to the Dharma,

original: rtag tu dkar po spyod pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: rtag tu dkar po spyod pa'o snyam mo //
translated: the one who always practices what is good.”

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should think,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun rnam pa du mar gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun rnam pa du mar gsungs pa ni /
translated: “The Blessed One has taught the Saṅgha in many ways,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun dang / don dam pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / cang shes kyi dge 'dun dang ; phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun no snyam mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun dang / don dam pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i dge 'dun dang / ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / cang shes kyi dge 'dun dang ; phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun no snyam mo //
translated: the conventional Saṅgha, the ultimate Saṅgha, the Saṅgha of those who are ashamed, the Saṅgha of those who are shameless, the Saṅgha of the noble ones, the Saṅgha of those who are self-disciplined, and the Saṅgha of those who are irreversible.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: “The bodhisattva practices in order to gather the conventional Saṅgha.

original: don dam pa'i dge 'dun la brten pa'i phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dge 'dun la brten pa'i phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: He practices in order to rely on the ultimate Saṅgha.

original: ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun yongs su gdul bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed de /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa'i dge 'dun yongs su gdul bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed de /
translated: He practices in order to guide the Saṅgha of those who are shameless.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mchod cing bsti stang du bya ba'i phyir rim gro byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mchod cing bsti stang du bya ba'i phyir rim gro byed do //
translated: He serves the Saṅgha of the noble ones in order to make offerings and show respect to them.

original: cang shes kyi dge 'dun la sangs rgyas bzhin du nan tan byed do //
analyzed: cang shes kyi dge 'dun la sangs rgyas bzhin du nan tan byed do //
translated: He practices in order to treat the Saṅgha of those who are self-disciplined like the Buddha.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun la chos kyi gtam gyi phyir nan tan byed do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun la chos kyi gtam gyi phyir nan tan byed do //
translated: He practices in order to have Dharma discussions with the Saṅgha of those who are irreversible.”

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: rigs 'dzin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams kyi dge 'dun yin no ;
analyzed: rigs 'dzin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams kyi dge 'dun yin no ;
translated: The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s sons is the Saṅgha of those who hold the lineage.

original: / yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rab tu spyin pa'i phyir zhing bzang po rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: / yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rab tu spyin pa'i phyir zhing bzang po rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of the good fields is the Saṅgha of those who give the fruit of what is pleasing.

original: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽yongs su 'dzin pa gtong zhing 'dor ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // yongs su 'dzin pa gtong zhing 'dor ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of the fearless is the Saṅgha of those who are free from the bad tendencies.🔽The Saṅgha of those whose minds are liberated is the Saṅgha of those who give up and abandon grasping.

original: shin tu dul ba'i phyir cang shes rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽ma 'dres pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba'i phyir cang shes rnams kyi dge 'dun no // ma 'dres pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are well-tamed is the Saṅgha of those who are well-tamed.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are without afflictions is the Saṅgha of those who are unadulterated.

original: sdig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: sdig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are ashamed is the Saṅgha of those who are free from evil.

original: bka' bla bde pa'i phyir slob ma rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bka' bla bde pa'i phyir slob ma rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of the disciples is the Saṅgha of those who are easy to talk to and happy.

original: bdag yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gi ba med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽zha ba'i phyir rgyags pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bdag yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gi ba med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // zha ba'i phyir rgyags pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have no “mine” because they have fully understood the self.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are free from conceit because they are free from pride.

original: 'dod pa nyung ba'i phyir phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyung ba'i phyir phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are free from error because they have few desires.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang dag par chad pa'i phyir nad med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽pha rol du son pa'i phyir thang la gnas pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang dag par chad pa'i phyir nad med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // pha rol du son pa'i phyir thang la gnas pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are free from disease because they have cut off discursive thought.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are on dry land because they have reached the other shore.

original: thang la gnas pa'i phyir @252b bde ba thob pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: thang la gnas pa'i phyir @252b bde ba thob pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have attained happiness because they are on dry land.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir bag yod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir bag yod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are heedful because they have seen reality.

original: skyon ma chags pa'i phyir dgon pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: skyon ma chags pa'i phyir dgon pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are in the wilderness because they are free from faults.

original: rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub la gzhol ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub la gzhol ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are intent on enlightenment because they are vast.

original: bslab pa gsum gyi bya ba shes pa'i phyir bslab pa 'dod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no ;
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi bya ba shes pa'i phyir bslab pa 'dod pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no ;
translated: The Saṅgha of those who desire training because they know the activities of the three trainings.

original: / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa spyod yul ba'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa spyod yul ba'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are mindful, because the four establishments of mindfulness are their domain.

original: yang dag par spong pa spyod yul pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa spyod yul pa'i phyir ngal ba med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽dbang po spyod yul pa'i phyir me phyed pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: yang dag par spong pa spyod yul pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa spyod yul pa'i phyir ngal ba med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // dbang po spyod yul pa'i phyir me phyed pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who have begun to make effort, because the four right efforts are their domain.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are tireless, because the four bases of supernatural power are their domain.🔽The Saṅgha of those who are not half-hearted, because the five faculties are their domain.

original: stobs spyod yul pa'i phyir tsher ma dkrugs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: stobs spyod yul pa'i phyir tsher ma dkrugs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who do not disturb the brambles, because the five powers are their domain.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag spyod yul pa'i phyir sgrib pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //🔽lam spyod yul pa'i phyir yang dag par lta ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag spyod yul pa'i phyir sgrib pa med pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no // lam spyod yul pa'i phyir yang dag par lta ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are free from obscurations, because the seven factors of awakening are their domain.🔽The Saṅgha of those who have right view, because the noble eightfold path is their domain.

original: bden pa spyod yul pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bden pa spyod yul pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of the noble ones, because the four truths are their domain.

original: bsam gtan spyod yul pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: bsam gtan spyod yul pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha of those who are concentrated, because the four meditative concentrations are their domain.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba spyod yul ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba spyod yul ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Sangha is the community of those who have turned the wheel of the Dharma, because their sphere is the practice of dependent origination.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Sangha is the community of the irreversible, because of their great compassion.

original: bsod nams thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no snyam mo //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun no snyam mo //
translated: The Sangha is the community of those who are impeded by one life, because of their accumulation of the provisions of all merit.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dge 'dun rjes su dran pas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dge 'dun rjes su dran pas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva who recollects the Sangha in this way thinks as follows:

original: gang dge 'dun gyi yang dag pa'i yon tan de dag ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyis kyang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dge 'dun gyi yang dag pa'i yon tan de dag ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyis kyang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish those qualities of the Sangha, together with all sentient beings.” This is the close mindfulness of the Sangha that is called the recollection of the Sangha.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the close mindfulness of morality that is called the recollection of morality?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here a bodhisattva thinks this:

original: gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad tshul khrims las byung bar pa lta'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad tshul khrims las byung bar pa lta'o //
translated: “Whatever is excellent in the world, whatever is excellent beyond the world, all that comes from morality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: tshul khrims ni phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
translated: Morality is the basis of all that is excellent.

original: 'di lta ste dper na sa ni sman dang rtsva dang nags tshal thams cad kyi gnas yin no //🔽de bzhin du tshul khrims kyang phun sun @253a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na sa ni sman dang rtsva dang nags tshal thams cad kyi gnas yin no // de bzhin du tshul khrims kyang phun sun @253a * //
translated: For example, the earth is the basis of all medicinal herbs, grasses, and forests.

original: tshogs pa thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa thams cad kyi gnas yin no //
translated: In the same way, morality is the basis of all that is excellent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa'i lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi spyin gnas yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa'i lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi spyin gnas yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in morality is a recipient of offerings for the world with its gods.

original: spyin pa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: spyin pa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He fulfills the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dga' ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gnas la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dga' ba skye ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is well established in morality experiences joy.

original: yid dga' bas 'gyod pa med do //
analyzed: yid dga' bas 'gyod pa med do //
translated: With a joyful mind, he has no regrets.

original: 'gyod pa med pas mchog tu dga' ba thob po //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pas mchog tu dga' ba thob po //
translated: Without regrets, he experiences supreme joy.

original: mchog tu dga' pas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' pas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: With supreme joy, his body and mind become fit.

original: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pas ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
analyzed: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pas ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
translated: With a fit body and mind, he attains concentration.

original: yid mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bam yin no //
analyzed: yid mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bam yin no //
translated: With a concentrated mind, he sees things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug go snyam mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug go snyam mo //
translated: The bodhisattva who sees things as they really are experiences great compassion for sentient beings.

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks:

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di dang chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong pa bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di dang chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong pa bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I must establish all sentient beings in this door of concentration and in the vision of things as they really are.

original: de snying rje chen po des bskul bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de snying rje chen po des bskul bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: And by the urging of that great compassion, having completed the trainings in higher morality, higher thought, and higher wisdom, he will fully awaken to supreme and complete buddhahood.

original: de bas na bdag gis kyang tshul khrims la gnas pa mi bskyod pa mi lhod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis kyang tshul khrims la gnas pa mi bskyod pa mi lhod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I too should abide in morality, unshakably and without laxity.

original: sems can thams cad mngon du byas nas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mngon du byas nas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I should guard morality, having all sentient beings in mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims de ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir gnas la mi gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims de ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir gnas la mi gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that morality of the bodhisattva is based on the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings, and not on anything else.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te ;
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should think as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims ni gnod sems med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims ni gnod sems med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva’s renunciation fulfills the perfection of non-violence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung pa'i tshul khrims ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung pa'i tshul khrims ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who has gone forth brings to completion the giving away of all possessions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang sdom pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang sdom pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who takes up the training and vows brings to completion the purification of body, speech, and mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par sems pa'i tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges par sems pa'i tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who reflects brings to completion the six superknowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi @253b phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi @253b phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who is well established brings to completion the factors of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyan pa'i tshul khrims ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyan pa'i tshul khrims ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who listens to the Dharma brings to completion the four analytical knowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i thos pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshul khrims ni nga rgyal med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i thos pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshul khrims ni nga rgyal med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's search for learning fulfills the perfection of the absence of pride.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge pa'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bsur byed pa'i tshul khrims ni yon tan gyi chos thams cad chung mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge pa'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bsur byed pa'i tshul khrims ni yon tan gyi chos thams cad chung mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's service to spiritual benefactors fulfills the perfection of the absence of contempt for anyone.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'i tshul khrims ni chos smra ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed do // byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'i tshul khrims ni chos smra ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's perfections fulfills the perfection of omniscient gnosis.🔽The morality of the bodhisattva's teaching of the Dharma as he has heard it fulfills the perfection of being a Dharma teacher.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sems pa'i phyir tshul khrims ni gzungs dang spobs pa thob pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sems pa'i phyir tshul khrims ni gzungs dang spobs pa thob pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva's reflection on the Dharma as he has heard it fulfills the perfection of the attainment of retention and eloquence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi tshul khrims ni skye thams cad la yang dag par 'da' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi tshul khrims ni skye thams cad la yang dag par 'da' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva’s intention to achieve enlightenment is fulfilled by the complete transcendence of all births.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva’s non-anger toward any living being is fulfilled by the non-loss of the intention to achieve enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems chud mi za ba'i tshul khrims ni dkon mchog gsum chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems chud mi za ba'i tshul khrims ni dkon mchog gsum chud mi za ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam mo //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva’s non-loss of the intention to achieve enlightenment is fulfilled by the non-loss of the Three Jewels.

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: And he thinks:🔽“By maintaining morality, I maintain all the observances.”

original: tshul khrims bsrung bas srung ba thams cad bsrungs pa yin no snyam pa 'di ni rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung bas srung ba thams cad bsrungs pa yin no snyam pa 'di ni rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This, son of good family, is called the bodhisattva’s application of mindfulness which is the recollection of morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gtod ba rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gtod ba rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of giving?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /🔽gang ci stong pa de thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te / gang ci stong pa de thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: zang zing gi gtong ba dang / chos kyi gtong ba dang gtong ba rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus so snyam mo //
analyzed: zang zing gi gtong ba dang / chos kyi gtong ba dang gtong ba rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus so snyam mo //
translated: Whatever is empty is included in the two kinds of giving: the giving of material things and the giving of the Dharma.

original: de la zang zing gi gtong bas ni byang chub sems pa'i mtshan dang dpye byad bzang po yongs su mi spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la zang zing gi gtong bas ni byang chub sems pa'i mtshan dang dpye byad bzang po yongs su mi spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By the giving of material things, the bodhisattva accomplishes the purification of the marks and the embellishments, the purification of the buddha-field, and the purification of the development of living beings.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par @254a * //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par @254a * //
translated: By the giving of the Dharma, he accomplishes the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: byed do // bag chags kyang yang dag par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: byed do // bag chags kyang yang dag par 'jog par byed do //
translated: and the latent tendencies are also properly placed.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong bas ni phung po thams cad nges par 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong bas ni phung po thams cad nges par 'dor bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, through the giving of material things, one definitely gives up all the aggregates.

original: chos kyi gtong pas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las yang dag par 'da'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong pas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las yang dag par 'da'o //
translated: Through the giving of the Dharma, one transcends the activities of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong bas ni skye ba'i lus yongs su sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong bas ni skye ba'i lus yongs su sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, through the giving of material things, one prepares the body for rebirth.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni chos kyi sku yongs su spyor bar byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni chos kyi sku yongs su spyor bar byed do //
translated: Through the giving of the Dharma, one prepares the body of the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen bo zang zing gi gtong bas ni pham las byung ba'i stobs sgrub par byed //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen bo zang zing gi gtong bas ni pham las byung ba'i stobs sgrub par byed //
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, through the giving of material things, the bodhisattva mahāsattva accomplishes the power that arises from merit.

original: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par su la yang med do //
analyzed: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par su la yang med do //
translated: That power does not exist for anyone except the Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas dwelling on the tenth bhūmi.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs sgrub par byed do //
translated: Through the giving of the Dharma, one accomplishes the power of miraculous abilities.

original: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par su la yang med do //
analyzed: stobs de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par su la yang med do //
translated: That power does not exist in anyone except the Tathagata and the Bodhisattva who is in his last lifetime.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni yongs su smin bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni yongs su smin bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, one causes them to mature by giving them material things.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni rnam pa tha dad par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni rnam pa tha dad par byed do //
translated: One causes them to be differentiated by giving them the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni tshogs stsogs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni tshogs stsogs so //
translated: Moreover, one causes them to accumulate by giving them material things.

original: chos kyi gtong pas ni sgrol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong pas ni sgrol lo //
translated: One causes them to be liberated by giving them the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni nor yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni nor yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: Moreover, one gives them wealth by giving them material things.

original: chos kyi gtong bas ni thams cad gtong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong bas ni thams cad gtong ngo //
translated: One gives them everything by giving them the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi gtong pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: Moreover, one causes them to attain liberation from the obscurations of the afflictions by giving them material things.

original: chos kyi gtong pas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bsgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gtong pas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bsgrub par byed do //
translated: One causes them to attain liberation from the obscurations to that which needs to be known by giving them the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang gtong ba zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su rtog pa gtong ba'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gtong ba zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su rtog pa gtong ba'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: Moreover, giving is a term that refers to the relinquishment of conceptualization.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yongs su rtog pa gtong pa de ni gtong pa rnams kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa gtong pa de ni gtong pa rnams kyi dam pa'o //
translated: Abandoning conceptualization is the highest abandonment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yongs su rtogs pa btang pa byang chub sems dpa' dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa btang pa byang chub sems dpa' dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Abandoning conceptualization is called the purity of bodhisattvas.

original: smra pas / rigs kyi bu yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di de gang gi tshig bla dags /🔽smras pa rigs kyi bu yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ni yang da pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: smra pas / rigs kyi bu yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di de gang gi tshig bla dags / smras pa rigs kyi bu yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ni yang da pa ma yin zhing /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkam­bhin then asked, “Son of noble family, what is the meaning of the term ‘conceptualization’?

original: med pa las sgro btags pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: med pa las sgro btags pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: ” He replied, “Son of noble family, the term ‘conceptualization’ is a term that is applied to what is not real and does not exist.

original: smras pa ; ji ltar na yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las sgro btags pa yin /
analyzed: smras pa ; ji ltar na yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las sgro btags pa yin /
translated: ” He asked, “How is it that it is not real and does not exist?

original: smras pa / nam 'di ltar bdag ni chags pa /🔽bdag ni zha sngar ba /
analyzed: smras pa / nam 'di ltar bdag ni chags pa / bdag ni zha sngar ba /
translated: ” He replied, “When one thinks, ‘I am attached,’🔽‘I am angry,’

original: bdag ni gti mug pa /
analyzed: bdag ni gti mug pa /
translated: ‘I am ignorant,’

original: bdag ni nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: bdag ni nyon mongs pa /
translated: ‘I am afflicted,’

original: bdag ni rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: bdag ni rnam par dag pa /
translated: ‘I am pure,’

original: bdag ni bcings pa /
analyzed: bdag ni bcings pa /
translated: ‘I am bound,’

original: bdag ni grol ba /
analyzed: bdag ni grol ba /
translated: ‘I am liberated,’

original: bdag ni 'khor ba /
analyzed: bdag ni 'khor ba /
translated: ‘I am in saṃsāra,’

original: bdag ni yongs @254b su mya ngan 'das pa'o snyam pa la sogs par sgro btags pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las yongs su btags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni yongs @254b su mya ngan 'das pa'o snyam pa la sogs par sgro btags pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin zhing med pa las yongs su btags pa'o //
translated: All the superimpositions, such as ‘I am completely liberated,’ are not real, but are superimpositions on what is unreal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen tsam ste /
translated: All of these are merely causes and conditions.

original: 'di la bdag dang bdag gi pa med pa /
analyzed: 'di la bdag dang bdag gi pa med pa /
translated: Here there is no self or anything that belongs to a self.

original: sems can med /🔽srog med / gang zag med /
analyzed: sems can med / srog med / gang zag med /
translated: There are no sentient beings,🔽no life-force, no person,

original: shed las skyes med do //
analyzed: shed las skyes med do //
translated: no human,

original: shed bu med do //
analyzed: shed bu med do //
translated: no humankind.

original: rgyu dang rkyen de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa /
translated: Those causes and conditions are also empty by nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis dpen pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dpen pa /
translated: isolated by nature,

translated: “What is a bodhisattva’s giving of everything?

original: po phun sum tshogs nas shin tu gtong ba byed de /
analyzed: po phun sum tshogs nas shin tu gtong ba byed de /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / mgo rus dang / rkang la sogs pa yongs su gtong pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / mgo rus dang / rkang la sogs pa yongs su gtong pa ste /

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shin tu gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shin tu gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a bodhisattva’s giving of everything.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' des gtong ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba de dag rjes su dran nas bdag gis kyang dran pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam pa de ni de'i gtong brjes su dran ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' des gtong ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba de dag rjes su dran nas bdag gis kyang dran pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam pa de ni de'i gtong brjes su dran ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva recollects those gifts, those great gifts, those extremely great gifts, and thinks, I too should complete those recollections. This is called the bodhisattva's recollection of giving.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gtong rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gtong rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva's close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of giving.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's close placement of mindfulness that is the recollection of the gods?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang rnam par dag pa'i lha nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag rjes su dran no //

translated: Here the bodhisattva recollects those gods who are pure, namely the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect buddhas.

original: 'di ltar de dag rjes su dran te sgrub pa dang / yon tan dang / skye ba dang / longs spyod dang / kun spyod pa dang / rtsom pa dang / rab tu thob pa dang / yongs su grub pas kyang rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag rjes su dran te sgrub pa dang / yon tan dang / skye ba dang / longs spyod dang / kun spyod pa dang / rtsom pa dang / rab tu thob pa dang / yongs su grub pas kyang rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, they are called the applications of mindfulness that recollect through practice, qualities, birth, enjoyments, conduct, undertakings, attainments, and accomplishments.

original: gang lha gzhan de dag kyang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: gang lha gzhan de dag kyang rjes su dran no //
translated: They also recollect other gods.

original: 'di ltar de dag rjes su dran te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag rjes su dran te /
translated: Thus, they recollect:

original: lha 'di dag ni las dge pa'i 'bras su las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lha 'di dag ni las dge pa'i 'bras su las byung ba'o //
translated: ‘These gods have arisen from the results of virtuous actions.

original: dge ba'i las de dag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i las de dag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those virtuous actions are as follows:

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las bzlog pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las bzlog pa rnams so //
translated: They are the opposite of the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: de la lha gang rnams kha dog gang ldan pa /
analyzed: de la lha gang rnams kha dog gang ldan pa /
translated: Among them, the gods who possess such and such a complexion,

original: bde ba mnga' ba /
analyzed: bde ba mnga' ba /
translated: who possess such and such enjoyments,

original: dbang po tshim pa /
analyzed: dbang po tshim pa /
translated: whose faculties are so and so,

original: de thams cad ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi rnam par smin pa'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de thams cad ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi rnam par smin pa'o snyam ste /
translated: all of that is the ripening of the ten wholesome courses of action.’

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' lha'i bde ba de la rjes su yi rang nas sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdo'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' lha'i bde ba de la rjes su yi rang nas sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdo'o //
translated: There, the bodhisattva rejoices in the happiness of the gods, and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for the benefit of all beings.

original: lha'i bde ba de yang sems can thams cad kyir 'dod do //
analyzed: lha'i bde ba de yang sems can thams cad kyir 'dod do //
translated: He wishes that happiness of the gods for all beings.

original: bde ba de sems can thams cad kyir 'dod pas //
analyzed: bde ba de sems can thams cad kyir 'dod pas //
translated: He wishes that happiness for all beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su grub rang bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po rtsom mo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su grub rang bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus chen po rtsom mo //
translated: He undertakes great effort to perfect the roots of virtue.

original: ngan song rnams su skyes pa'i sems can dag la snying rje chen po bskyed de /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su skyes pa'i sems can dag la snying rje chen po bskyed de /
translated: He generates great compassion for beings born in the lower realms.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag gis 'di ltar sems can thams cad lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byed du gzung ngo //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag gis 'di ltar sems can thams cad lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byed du gzung ngo //
translated: He thinks, “I will cause all beings to take up the actions that lead to rebirth in the world of the gods.

original: sems can thams cad gang dag lhar gyur pa de dag ni bla na @255b bad pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //🔽gang gis sems can rnams la lha'i bde ba thob nas phyis nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / bde bar gyur nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dag lhar gyur pa de dag ni bla na @255b bad pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o // gang gis sems can rnams la lha'i bde ba thob nas phyis nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / bde bar gyur nas 'di lta ste /
translated: I will cause all sentient beings to become gods, and then to awaken to highest genuine full Awakening.🔽I will cause sentient beings to do actions that will lead to the happiness of gods, and then to the happiness of humans, and then to the happiness of Arhats, and then to the happiness of Pratyekabuddhas, and then to the happiness of Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar zhi ba'i bde pa thob par 'gyur ba'i las de dag sems can rnams byed du gzhug go snyam du sems pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar zhi ba'i bde pa thob par 'gyur ba'i las de dag sems can rnams byed du gzhug go snyam du sems pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: I will cause sentient beings to do actions that will lead to the happiness of gods, and then to the happiness of humans, and then to the happiness of Arhats, and then to the happiness of Pratyekabuddhas, and then to the happiness of Buddhas, and then to the happiness of the Tathāgatas’ peace.🔽This is called the bodhisattvas’ close placement of mindfulness of gods.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran nye bar gzhag pa bcu'o zhes te /
