analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran nye bar gzhag pa bcu'o zhes te /
translated: Noble sir, these are the ten close placements of mindfulness of bodhisattvas.

original: de dag gang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de dag gang ldan pas na /
translated: Those who have these

original: de nyid dran pa chen po 'chang //
analyzed: de nyid dran pa chen po 'chang //
translated: are called “greatly mindful ones.”

original: zhes bya'o // dra na pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i dran pa'i tshul can dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin brgya stong gi bdag por gyur bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dra na pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i dran pa'i tshul can dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin brgya stong gi bdag por gyur bas na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dran pa bzhi po ting 'dzin rgyal //
analyzed: dran pa bzhi po ting 'dzin rgyal //
translated: The four mindfulnesses are the victors of samadhi.

original: zhes bya'o // byang chub yan lag me tog spos //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // byang chub yan lag me tog spos //
translated: The flowers of the branches of enlightenment are the incense.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ocean of qualities of the tathagatas.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams nyid ni me tog ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams nyid ni me tog ste /
translated: The flowers of the branches of enlightenment are the incense.

original: de rnams kyi dri ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa'i rab 'byam khyab pa'i yon tan dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dri ni khyad par gang la yod pa de ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dri ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa'i rab 'byam khyab pa'i yon tan dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dri ni khyad par gang la yod pa de ni /
translated: The fragrance of those flowers pervades the entire world system. The fragrance of the qualities and wisdom of the tathagatas is the incense.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: byang chub yan lag me tog spos //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag me tog spos //
translated: The flowers of the branches of enlightenment are the incense.

original: zhes bya'o // de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven branches of enlightenment?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: dran pha yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang ;
analyzed: dran pha yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang ;
translated: the factor of perfect awakening that is pliancy,🔽the factor of perfect awakening that is meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: and the factor of perfect awakening that is equanimity.

original: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the factor of perfect awakening that is mindfulness?

original: dran pa gang gis chos rnams rtogs 'gyur ba gang /🔽chos rnams so so rtog pa gang /🔽chos rnams la dpyod pa gang /
analyzed: dran pa gang gis chos rnams rtogs 'gyur ba gang / chos rnams so so rtog pa gang / chos rnams la dpyod pa gang /
translated: It is that by which one realizes phenomena.🔽It is the discernment of phenomena.🔽It is the investigation of phenomena.

original: chos rnams la kun du 'gro ba gang /🔽chos rnams la bsam pa gang /
analyzed: chos rnams la kun du 'gro ba gang / chos rnams la bsam pa gang /
translated: It is the thorough investigation of phenomena.🔽It is the reflection on phenomena.

original: chos rnams la rjes su rtog pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la rjes su rtog pa ste /
translated: It is the investigation of phenomena.

original: de dran pa des chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dran pa des chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that mindfulness, one realizes the intrinsic identity of things.

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic identity of things?

original: chos thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: All things are empty of their intrinsic identity.

original: gang gis de ltar dran zhing rtogs pa 'di ni @256a * //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar dran zhing rtogs pa 'di ni @256a * //
translated: That by which one is mindful and realizes this

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: is called the enlightenment factor of right mindfulness.

original: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhen /
analyzed: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhen /
translated: What is the enlightenment factor of investigation of phenomena?

original: gang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that thoroughly investigates the eighty-four thousand aggregates of phenomena.🔽Whatever phenomena are to be investigated,🔽whatever they are like,

original: chos gang dang / gang ji lta ji lta bur rnam par dbye par bya ba nges pa'i don kyang nges pa'i don du /🔽drang ba'i don kyang drang ba'i don du /🔽kun rdzob kyi don kyang kun rdzob kyi don du /
analyzed: chos gang dang / gang ji lta ji lta bur rnam par dbye par bya ba nges pa'i don kyang nges pa'i don du / drang ba'i don kyang drang ba'i don du / kun rdzob kyi don kyang kun rdzob kyi don du /
translated: the definitive meaning is ascertained as definitive meaning,🔽the provisional meaning is ascertained as provisional meaning,🔽the conventional meaning is ascertained as conventional meaning,

original: don dam pa yang don dam par /🔽brda yang brdar /
analyzed: don dam pa yang don dam par /🔽brda yang brdar /
translated: the ultimate meaning is ascertained as ultimate meaning,🔽and symbols are ascertained as symbols.

original: rnam par nges pa yang rnam par nges par /
analyzed: rnam par nges pa yang rnam par nges par /
translated: and certainty is certain.

original: chos de dang de dag de lta de lta bur rnam par 'byed pa'i 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dang de dag de lta de lta bur rnam par 'byed pa'i 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the factor of complete awakening that is discrimination of phenomena.

original: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhen /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhen /
translated: “What is the factor of complete awakening that is effort?

original: gang dran pa 'di dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms shes pa 'di rab tu 'dzin pa dang / spros ba dang / stobs dang / brtul ba dang /
analyzed: gang dran pa 'di dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms shes pa 'di rab tu 'dzin pa dang / spros ba dang / stobs dang / brtul ba dang /
translated: It is the retention, the development, the strength, the courage,

original: phyir mi ldog pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mthu dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba dang / lam mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mthu dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba dang / lam mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: the irreversibility, the aspiration, the power, the non-abandonment of effort, and the effort for the realization of the path. This is called the factor of complete awakening that is effort.

original: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the factor of complete awakening that is joy?

original: chos la dga' ba dang / chos la mos pa dang / chos la mchog tu dga' ba gang gis sems ma gong ba dang / dang cing 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: chos la dga' ba dang / chos la mos pa dang / chos la mchog tu dga' ba gang gis sems ma gong ba dang / dang cing 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is the delight in the Dharma, the interest in the Dharma, the joy in the Dharma, the mental orientation, the desire, and the aspiration for the Dharma.

original: chos la dga' ba gang gis lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa rnams sel ba 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos la dga' ba gang gis lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa rnams sel ba 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: It is the delight in the Dharma by which the body and mind become fit, and by which the afflictions are eliminated. This is called the limb of awakening of joy.

original: de la shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na ;
translated: “What is the limb of awakening of pliancy?

original: gang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pas nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / sgrib pa dang bral ba dang / zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i dmigs pa la sems gzhol ba 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pas nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / sgrib pa dang bral ba dang / zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i dmigs pa la sems gzhol ba 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: It is the pliancy of body and mind by which the afflictions are eliminated, the obscurations are removed, and the mind is focused on the object of concentration. This is called the limb of awakening of pliancy.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na ;
translated: “What is the limb of awakening of concentration?

original: gang sems mnyam par gzhag pas chos kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i /
analyzed: gang sems mnyam par gzhag pas chos kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i /
translated: The mind that is concentrated fully awakens to the knowledge of reality,

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but the unconcentrated mind does not.

original: gang sems mnyam par gzhag pas chos de dag mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: gang sems mnyam par gzhag pas chos de dag mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The mind that is concentrated fully awakens to those dharmas,

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni ma yin te /
translated: but the unconcentrated mind does not.

original: lta ba dang bag la nyal @256b dang kun nas ldang ba de dag bor bas kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
analyzed: lta ba dang bag la nyal @256b dang kun nas ldang ba de dag bor bas kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
translated: One does not fully awaken by abandoning views, latent tendencies, and obsessions,

original: gzhan du na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad tha dad du dbye ba med pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad tha dad du dbye ba med pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: but rather by fully awakening to the equality of all dharmas, since all dharmas are undifferentiated.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the enlightenment factor of meditative concentration.

original: de la btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: “What, venerable friends, is the enlightenment factor of equanimity?

original: gang 'di yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba cha dang mthun ba'i chos rnams kyis sems yongs su mi gtugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang mtho dman du mi gnas pa'i phyir mi sgul ba yin /
analyzed: gang 'di yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba cha dang mthun ba'i chos rnams kyis sems yongs su mi gtugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang mtho dman du mi gnas pa'i phyir mi sgul ba yin /
translated: It is unshakable because the mind is not overwhelmed by factors conducive to mental pleasure and displeasure, it is not carried away by mundane entities, and it does not remain in a state of high or low spirits.

original: gnod pa med pa dang / 'phrogs pa med pa dang / rjes su chags pa med pa dang / zhe 'gras pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bde ba'i lam dang mthun pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa dang / 'phrogs pa med pa dang / rjes su chags pa med pa dang / zhe 'gras pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bde ba'i lam dang mthun pa 'di ni /
translated: It is not harmed, not carried away, not attached, not averse, and it is conducive to the noble blissful path.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: This is called the branch of enlightenment of equanimity.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: byang chub yan lag me tog spos //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag me tog spos //
translated: it is the flower of the branches of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the ocean of the qualities of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'di la sems shing rtog pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'di la sems shing rtog pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho ste /
translated: It is the ocean of the qualities of the Tathāgata because it thinks and conceives of these qualities of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ram thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ram thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because it is the basis of all tathāgatas, or because its qualities are not shared in common, it is the eighteen unshared qualities and so on.

original: de'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of those.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po ston pa las /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po ston pa las /
translated: The perfection of wisdom in twenty-five thousand lines, which teaches the Mahāyāna,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan rnams gsungs te /
translated: teaches the unshared qualities.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, moreover, the Mahāyāna of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen unshared qualities of the buddhas?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //🔽ca co mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o // ca co mi mnga'o //
translated: The tathāgatas are without error.🔽They are without grumbling.

original: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: They are without incomprehension.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //🔽thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o // thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: They are without various kinds of discernment.🔽They are without a lack of meditative equipoise.

original: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: They are without equanimity that is not thoroughly examined.

original: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in interest.

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //🔽dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o // dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in effort.🔽He does not have any decline in intention.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in meditative absorption.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All his physical actions are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //🔽gsung gi @257a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo // gsung gi @257a * //
translated: They follow wisdom.

original: phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All his verbal actions are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow wisdom.

original: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow wisdom.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
translated: His vision of wisdom is unimpeded and unattached with regard to the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
translated: His wisdom vision penetrates the future without attachment or obstruction.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
translated: His wisdom vision penetrates the present without attachment or obstruction.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These are the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //
translated: Knowing the eightfold path, the Buddha knows the path.

original: zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rig pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong du ma gyur ba yongs su mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rig pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong du ma gyur ba yongs su mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Knowing the eightfold noble path is knowing what is not shared in common with the disciples and solitary sages.

original: de nyid kyis ni sangs rgyas lam rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni sangs rgyas lam rig pa'o //
translated: By that, he knows the path of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni blo gros mi zad bas bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni blo gros mi zad bas bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the Sutra Teaching the Inexhaustible Intellect:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mi zad pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Shariputra, the bodhisattvas’ path is inexhaustible.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ path?

original: lam zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: The so-called path is the eightfold path of the noble ones.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag ba'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag ba'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag ba'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag ba'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is right view?

original: gang 'di 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'di 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: It is the supramundane view of the noble ones.

original: bdag tu lta ba las kun nas langs pa ma yin te /🔽sems can du ma yin /🔽srog tu ma yin /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba las kun nas langs pa ma yin te / sems can du ma yin / srog tu ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from the view of a self,🔽not from the view of a sentient being,

original: gso bar ma yin /
analyzed: gso bar ma yin /
translated: not from the view of a living being,

original: skyes bur ma yin /🔽gang zag tu ma yin /🔽shed las skyes su ma yin /
analyzed: skyes bur ma yin / gang zag tu ma yin / shed las skyes su ma yin /
translated: not from the view of one who is born,🔽not from the view of an individual,

original: shed bur ma yin /
analyzed: shed bur ma yin /
translated: not from the view of humankind,🔽not from the view of human beings,

original: byed pa por ma yin /
analyzed: byed pa por ma yin /
translated: not from the view of a creator,

original: tshor ba por lta ba las kun nas langs pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba por lta ba las kun nas langs pa ma yin /
translated: and not from the view of a feeler.

original: rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba las kun nas langs ba ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba las kun nas langs ba ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from the views of eternalism or nihilism.

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jig par lta ba las kun nas langs pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jig par lta ba las kun nas langs pa ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from the views of origination or destruction.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston par lta ba las kun nas langs pa yang ma yin pa nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par lta ba'i bar las kun nas langs pa yang ma yin te 'di ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston par lta ba las kun nas langs pa yang ma yin pa nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par lta ba'i bar las kun nas langs pa yang ma yin te 'di ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It does not arise from the views of virtue, nonvirtue, or the indeterminate, up to and including the views of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa. This is called right view.

original: de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right thought?

original: rtog pa gang dag gis @257b 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa dag kun du 'byung ba'i kun du rtog pa de dag la mi rtog pa dang / rtog pa gang gis tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: rtog pa gang dag gis @257b 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa dag kun du 'byung ba'i kun du rtog pa de dag la mi rtog pa dang / rtog pa gang gis tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: It is the absence of thoughts that give rise to the afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance. It is the thought that gives rise to morality, samādhi,

original: shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams kun du 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag rtog pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams kun du 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag rtog pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conception that is the arising of the aggregates of morality, meditative absorption, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation is called right conception.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right speech?

original: dag gang gis bdag la yang yongs su mi gdung zhing gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag la yang kun nas nyan mongs pa med par byed cing /
analyzed: dag gang gis bdag la yang yongs su mi gdung zhing gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag la yang kun nas nyan mongs pa med par byed cing /
translated: It is the speech by which one does not torment oneself or others, and by which one does not create any affliction for oneself or others.

original: gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag la yang mi gnod cing gzhan la ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag la yang mi gnod cing gzhan la ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is the speech by which one does not harm oneself or others.

original: dag gang gis 'phags pa'i lam la legs par 'jug pa mnyam par gzhag pa la brtson pa'i dag de la ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dag gang gis 'phags pa'i lam la legs par 'jug pa mnyam par gzhag pa la brtson pa'i dag de la ldan pa yin te /
translated: It is the speech by which one enters the path of the noble ones and is endowed with the speech of one who is intent on meditative absorption.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i dag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called right speech.

original: de la yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right action?

original: gang las kyang gnag la rnam par smin pa yang gnag pa'i las de mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / gang las kyang dkar la rnam par smin pa yang dkar ba'i las de mngon par 'du byed pa dang / gang las kyang dkar gnag la rnam par smin pa yang dkar gnag du 'gyur ba'i las de mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gang las kyang gnag la rnam par smin pa yang gnag pa'i las de mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / gang las kyang dkar la rnam par smin pa yang dkar ba'i las de mngon par 'du byed pa dang / gang las kyang dkar gnag la rnam par smin pa yang dkar gnag du 'gyur ba'i las de mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang /
translated: He does not create any action that is black and has black results, and he creates the action that is white and has white results. He does not create any action that is black and white and has black and white results.

original: las gang mi gnag mi dkar zhing rnam par smin pa yang med la /🔽las kyis las zad par 'gyur ba'i las de mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: las gang mi gnag mi dkar zhing rnam par smin pa yang med la / las kyis las zad par 'gyur ba'i las de mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: He creates the action that is neither black nor white and has neither black nor white results,🔽and that action exhausts action.

original: de las la rton pas yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la brtson pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las la rton pas yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la brtson pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “ Relying on action, he is called ‘one who is dedicated to right action.’

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘right action.’

original: de la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
translated: “ What is right livelihood?

original: gang 'phags pa'i rigs dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs par mi gtong ba dang / tshul 'chos med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / dgang sla ba dang / gso sla ba dang /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i rigs dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs par mi gtong ba dang / tshul 'chos med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / dgang sla ba dang / gso sla ba dang /
translated: It is not to abandon the family of the noble ones, the qualities of purification, or the practice of austerity; it is not to be hypocritical, or to flatter, or to be pretentious, or to be greedy, or to be easy to maintain, or to be difficult to support.

original: cho ga bzang po'i dang tshul can dang / gzhan gyi rnyed pa la phrag dog med pa dang / bdag gi rnyed pas cho ga shes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'phags pas gnang ba'i 'tsho ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzang po'i dang tshul can dang / gzhan gyi rnyed pa la phrag dog med pa dang / bdag gi rnyed pas cho ga shes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'phags pas gnang ba'i 'tsho ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is to have good conduct, to not be jealous of the gains of others, to be satisfied with one’s own gains, to be without fault, and to have a livelihood that is approved by the noble ones. This is called right livelihood.

original: de la yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right effort?

original: rtsol ba gang log pa 'phags pa rnams kyis ma gnang pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis nyon mongs pa @258a * //
analyzed: rtsol ba gang log pa 'phags pa rnams kyis ma gnang pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis nyon mongs pa @258a * //
translated: It is the effort that is not approved by the noble ones, which is afflicted by desire, anger, and ignorance, and which is not conducive to the destruction of the contaminants.

original: bag la nyal bar byed pa'i rtsol pa de mi 'dod cing rtsol ba gang yang dag pa 'phags pa'i lam dang / bden pa la 'jug pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam du gtong pa'i brtson pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal bar byed pa'i rtsol pa de mi 'dod cing rtsol ba gang yang dag pa 'phags pa'i lam dang / bden pa la 'jug pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam du gtong pa'i brtson pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort that is not directed toward the latent tendencies, but is directed toward the effort that is the path of the noble ones, that is the effort that is the path that leads to nirvāṇa, that is called right effort.

original: de la yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right mindfulness?

original: dran pa gang shin tu nye bar gzhag pa dang / mi sgul ba dang / drang ba dang / gya gyu med pa dang / 'khor ba'i skyon gyi nyes dmigs la lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam du 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa gang shin tu nye bar gzhag pa dang / mi sgul ba dang / drang ba dang / gya gyu med pa dang / 'khor ba'i skyon gyi nyes dmigs la lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam du 'dren pa ste /
translated: It is the mindfulness that is very present, unshakable, straight, and without crookedness, that sees the faults and problems of saṃsāra, and that leads to the path that goes to nirvāṇa.

original: dran pa dang / gzhungs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam mi brjed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang / gzhungs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam mi brjed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the mindfulness, the memory, the not forgetting the path of the noble ones. That is called right mindfulness.

original: de la yang dag ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right samādhi?

original: yang dag pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / gang chos thams cad kyis mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / gang chos thams cad kyis mnyam pa ste /
translated: The sameness of the real is the sameness of all dharmas.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pas sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag ba nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pas sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag ba nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The samādhi in which one abides in order to liberate all beings and to enter into the certainty of the real is called right samādhi.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas nas sems can thams cad rab tu thar par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa nges par gyur pa la mi 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi zad pa zhes
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas nas sems can thams cad rab tu thar par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa nges par gyur pa la mi 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi zad pa zhes
translated: The samādhi in which the bodhisattva does not abide in order to liberate all beings and to enter into the certainty of the real is called the bodhisattva’s imperishable right samādhi.

original: bya'o // 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi lam ste /
analyzed: bya'o // 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi lam ste /
translated: This is the path of the past, future, and present Buddhas, Blessed Ones.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / klog tu 'jug pa dang / shes par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / klog tu 'jug pa dang / shes par byed pa dang /
translated: When the bodhisattva has attained perfect buddhahood, he teaches, reveals, makes clear, causes to take up, causes to aspire, causes to read, causes to understand,🔽causes to know, causes to fully know, causes to enter, causes to explain, causes to distinguish, causes to discern, causes to illuminate, and causes to reveal.

original: rnam par shes par byed pa dang / rab tu shes par byed pa dang / rab tu 'dzud pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa 'di ni btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mi zad pa zhes bya'o //🔽sems can thams cad mi gnas ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug pa'i thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur bas na /
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pa dang / rab tu shes par byed pa dang / rab tu 'dzud pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa 'di ni btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mi zad pa zhes bya'o // sems can thams cad mi gnas ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug pa'i thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur bas na /
translated: This, Venerable Subhūti, is called the bodhisattvas' imperishable path.🔽Because of the great compassion that causes all sentient beings to enter non-abiding nirvana,

original: sems can kun la shas cher chags //
analyzed: sems can kun la shas cher chags //
translated: [the bodhisattva] has great attachment to all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya'o // chos thams cad dngos po med par thugs su chud pa'i dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // chos thams cad dngos po med par thugs su chud pa'i dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
translated: Because he is the embodiment of the stainless perfection of wisdom that comprehends the unreality of all things,

original: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
translated: he is like space, free of attachment.

original: @258b ces bya'o //
analyzed: @258b ces bya'o //
translated: Thus.🔽Because he is born as the lord of the bodhisattvas, whose nature is immeasurable method, wisdom, and compassion, and because he appears individually to those who are to be trained,

original: dpag tu med pa'i thabs dang shes rab dang thugs rje'i rang bzhin can gyi rgyal ba'i sras kyi bdag por 'khrungs par gdul bya rnams la so sor snang bas na phan tshun gcig la gcig mi mthun pa'i sems med par sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi chos
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i thabs dang shes rab dang thugs rje'i rang bzhin can gyi rgyal ba'i sras kyi bdag por 'khrungs par gdul bya rnams la so sor snang bas na phan tshun gcig la gcig mi mthun pa'i sems med par sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi chos
translated: he has no discordant thoughts toward each other.

original: nyid mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas na ;
analyzed: nyid mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas na ;
translated: Because he comprehends the equality of the reality of the minds of all sentient beings,

original: sems can kun gyi yid la 'jug / ces bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid la 'jug / ces bya ba yin gyi /
translated: he enters the minds of all sentient beings.🔽Thus.

original: sems sems gzhan dag gi nang du zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems sems gzhan dag gi nang du zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But he does not enter the minds of other sentient beings,

original: gzhan rigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that he would be other.

original: de bas na der gshegs shing thugs su chud pa nyid 'dul ba'i dus las mi 'da' bar myur ba nyid du gdul bya thams cad la cig car sems kyi rjes su 'gro bas chos kyi de nyid snang bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de bas na der gshegs shing thugs su chud pa nyid 'dul ba'i dus las mi 'da' bar myur ba nyid du gdul bya thams cad la cig car sems kyi rjes su 'gro bas chos kyi de nyid snang bar mdzad pas na /
translated: Therefore, the buddhas, who have gone there and who have realized it, do not pass beyond the time for training beings. They immediately illuminate the suchness of phenomena to all those to be trained, by acting in accordance with their minds.🔽

original: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs //🔽zhes bya'o // dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rab dang 'bring dang chung du mkhyen nas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs // zhes bya'o // dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rab dang 'bring dang chung du mkhyen nas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par mdzad pas na /
translated: Therefore, he is called “swift as the mind of all beings” because he illuminates the reality of phenomena by going there and understanding it, and by not passing beyond the time of taming, but by quickly and simultaneously going along with the minds of all those to be tamed.

original: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes //🔽zhes bya'o // sems can thams cad rjes su mthun pa'i sku yid 'phrog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po ston par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes // zhes bya'o // sems can thams cad rjes su mthun pa'i sku yid 'phrog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po ston par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is called “knowing the meaning of the faculties of all beings” because he teaches the Dharma in accordance with the superior, middling, and lesser faculties of faith and so forth.

original: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrog pa //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrog pa //
translated: He is called “captivating the minds of all beings” because he displays a form that is in accordance with all beings and is captivating.

original: zhes bya'o // gzugs ni dbu ba lta bu ste //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gzugs ni dbu ba lta bu ste //
translated: Form is like foam,

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage,

original: 'du byed chu shing snying po 'dra //
analyzed: 'du byed chu shing snying po 'dra //
translated: Formation is like a plantain tree,

original: rnam par shes pa sgyu 'drar shes //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sgyu 'drar shes //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis rab tu gsungs //
translated: The Friend of the Sun has taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po kun rdzob kyi de kho na nyid dang / don dam par gzod nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid du phung po lnga'i de kho na nyid mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po kun rdzob kyi de kho na nyid dang / don dam par gzod nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid du phung po lnga'i de kho na nyid mkhyen pas na /
translated: Thus, by knowing the reality of the five aggregates as the conventional nature of the aggregates of form, etc., and as the nature of the primordially unborn reality,

original: phung po lnga don de nyid shes //
analyzed: phung po lnga don de nyid shes //
translated: he is the knower of the reality of the five aggregates.

original: zhes bya'o // tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo 'dzin par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is the holder of the pure nature of the aggregates of morality, meditative stabilization, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba //
analyzed: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba //
translated: He is the holder of the five pure aggregates.

original: zhes bya'o // nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nges par 'byung ba'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nges par 'byung ba'i mtha' ste /
translated: He is the end of the definite deliverance of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas.

original: mtha' thug pa la rab tu 'jog pa'i tshul gyis rab tu bzhugs pas na /
analyzed: mtha' thug pa la rab tu 'jog pa'i tshul gyis rab tu bzhugs pas na /
translated: He is called

original: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas //🔽zhes pa'o // nges par 'byung ba thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par thugs su chud pas na /
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas // zhes pa'o // nges par 'byung ba thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par thugs su chud pas na /
translated: Dwelling at the end of all paths of deliverance.🔽He is called

original: nges par 'byung pa kun la mkhas //
analyzed: nges par 'byung pa kun la mkhas //
translated: Skilled in all paths of deliverance.

original: zhes bya'o // nges bar @259a * //🔽'byung ba'i lam thams cad la zhugs pa'i tshul gyis lam de la 'jug par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // nges bar @259a * // 'byung ba'i lam thams cad la zhugs pa'i tshul gyis lam de la 'jug par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is called

original: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas //🔽zhes bya'o // theg pa gcig gis lam ston par mdzad kyang rim gyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi ngo bor theg pa thams cad ston par mdzad pas na ;
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas // zhes bya'o // theg pa gcig gis lam ston par mdzad kyang rim gyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi ngo bor theg pa thams cad ston par mdzad pas na ;
translated: Dwelling on the path of all paths of deliverance.🔽He is called

original: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa //
translated: Teaching all paths of deliverance.

original: zhes bya'o // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can gyi srid pa ming gzhan du na 'khor ba zhes kyang bya ba dngos po med pa nyid du rab tu bstan pas mi snang bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can gyi srid pa ming gzhan du na 'khor ba zhes kyang bya ba dngos po med pa nyid du rab tu bstan pas mi snang bar mdzad pas na /
translated: Existence, which is characterized by the twelvefold dependent origination and is also called “samsara, ” is taught to be non-existent.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //🔽zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton // zhes bya ste ;
translated: He has removed the root of the twelvefold existence.🔽Because he has removed the root of existence, he is the one who has removed the root of the twelvefold existence.

original: skye ba med pa la ni rtsa nas bton pa mi srid do //🔽de yang 'phags pas bcu pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la ni rtsa nas bton pa mi srid do // de yang 'phags pas bcu pa'i mdo las /
translated: For that which is unborn cannot have a root that is removed.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i rgyu nyid rgya cher gsungs pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i rgyu nyid rgya cher gsungs pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the noble Dashabhumika Sutra extensively teaches the causes of the forward and reverse progressions of the twelvefold dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos smras pa /
translated: Vajra garbha said,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'jug go //
translated: “O sons of the victors, in that way, the bodhisattva who has completed the bodhisattva stages enters the sixth bodhisattva stage.

original: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug ste /
analyzed: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug ste /
translated: It is engaged through ten equalities of phenomena.

original: bcug gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mi skye ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad ma byung ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dben pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mi skye ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad ma byung ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dben pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The equality of all phenomena being without signs, the equality of all phenomena being without characteristics, the equality of all phenomena being unborn, the equality of all phenomena being unarisen, the equality of all phenomena being void,

original: chos thams cad snga nas rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad spros pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad blang ba dang / dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad snga nas rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad spros pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad blang ba dang / dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang /
translated: the equality of all phenomena being primordially pure, the equality of all phenomena being free from elaborations, the equality of all phenomena being free from acceptance and rejection, the equality of all phenomena being like an illusion, a dream, an optical illusion,

original: sgra brnyan dang / chu'i zla ba dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgra brnyan dang / chu'i zla ba dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: It is the sameness of all phenomena, which are neither existent nor nonexistent nor both.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag chos mnyam pa nyid bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag chos mnyam pa nyid bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'jug go //
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, through these ten samenesses, bodhisattvas enter the sixth bhumi.

original: de chos thams cad la rang bzhin de 'dra bar rab tu rtog cing dpyod pa dang mthun par sems shing mi phyed pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon @259b pos 'thob ste /
analyzed: de chos thams cad la rang bzhin de 'dra bar rab tu rtog cing dpyod pa dang mthun par sems shing mi phyed pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon @259b pos 'thob ste /
translated: As they thoroughly investigate and analyze all phenomena in this way, they contemplate in accordance with the realization of the sixth bhumi and, with sharp, concordant acceptance, they attain the sixth bodhisattva bhumi.

original: 'on kyang da dung mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa mngon du gyur pa ni thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang da dung mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa mngon du gyur pa ni thob pa ma yin no //
translated: However, they have not yet attained the manifest realization of acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: de chos thams cad la rang bzhin de ltar rtog pa'i tshe de bas kyang snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba dang / snying rje chen po la dbang bskur ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig rten pa la rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: de chos thams cad la rang bzhin de ltar rtog pa'i tshe de bas kyang snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba dang / snying rje chen po la dbang bskur ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig rten pa la rnam par lta'o //
translated: When he considers the nature of all things in this way, he also considers the origination and destruction of the world, in order to perfect his great compassion, to increase his great compassion, to generate his great compassion, to purify his great compassion, to have recourse to great compassion, to intensify his great compassion, and to make his great compassion grow.

original: de 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
translated: “When he considers the origination and destruction of the world, he thinks to himself:

original: 'jig rten kun tu rgyu ba'i skye bo ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun tu rgyu ba'i skye bo ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
translated: ‘All the people who are born in the world are born because of their attachment to a self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na /
translated: If they were free from attachment to a self,

original: 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: they would not be born.’

original: byis ba'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rab kyis sgrib pa yod pa dang med pa dang mngon par mos pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la gzhol pas yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu zhugs pa log pa'i
analyzed: byis ba'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rab kyis sgrib pa yod pa dang med pa dang mngon par mos pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la gzhol pas yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu zhugs pa log pa'i
translated: The childish, who are obscured by the ignorance of manifest clinging to a self, are not interested in existence and nonexistence. They are engaged in incorrect mental activity and thus are engaged in what is not real.🔽

original: rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed nye bar stsogs te ;
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed nye bar stsogs te ;
translated: Those who are childish, who are attached to the notion of a self, who are obscured by ignorance, who are attached to existence and nonexistence, who are engaged in incorrect mental activity, who are engaged in what is not real, who are followers of what is wrong, they accumulate meritorious and nonmeritorious formations.

original: 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rgya shi dang yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa 'byung bar nye bar song ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rgya shi dang yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa 'byung bar nye bar song ba yin te /
translated: The seed of mind that is infused by those formations, which is contaminated and appropriated, is the source of the arising of future birth, old age, and death, and it is the source of the occurrence of future existence.

original: las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / srid pa'i snum dang / nga'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dang / dran pa rab tu 'phel bas ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung ste /
analyzed: las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / srid pa'i snum dang / nga'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dang / dran pa rab tu 'phel bas ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung ste /
translated: and the sprout of name-and-form arises through the increase of memory.

original: byung nas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: byung nas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: Having arisen, it grows.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu rnam par 'phel nas dbang po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu rnam par 'phel nas dbang po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sprout of name-and-form grows, the five faculties arise.

original: dbang po lnga byung nas phan tshun 'dus shing phrad pas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga byung nas phan tshun 'dus shing phrad pas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the five faculties arise, they mutually assemble and contact occurs.

original: reg pa 'dus pas tshor bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa 'dus pas tshor bar 'byung ngo //
translated: From the assembly of contact, feeling arises.

original: tshor nas de'i rjes su mngon par smon pas sred par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshor nas de'i rjes su mngon par smon pas sred par 'byung ngo //
translated: Having felt, craving arises through the aspiration for that.

original: sred pas ni nye par len par rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: sred pas ni nye par len par rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Craving increases appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel ba las srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel ba las srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the increase of appropriation, existence arises.

original: srid pa byung nas phung po lnga 'byung par 'gyur te phung po lnga byung nas lam gyi rgyud lngar rim gyis dengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa byung nas phung po lnga 'byung par 'gyur te phung po lnga byung nas lam gyi rgyud lngar rim gyis dengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is becoming, the five aggregates come into being. When the five aggregates have come into being, they gradually disintegrate in the five destinies.

original: de dengs nas 'bral par 'gyur te /🔽dengs shing bral ba mi dga' zhing yongs su gdung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dengs nas 'bral par 'gyur te / dengs shing bral ba mi dga' zhing yongs su gdung par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they have disintegrated, they separate.🔽When they have disintegrated and separated, there is unhappiness and distress.

original: mi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyus mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa 'byung bar 'gyur yang @260a * //
analyzed: mi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyus mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa 'byung bar 'gyur yang @260a * //
translated: From unhappiness and distress, sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and agitation arise.

original: de dag la su yang 'byung bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: de dag la su yang 'byung bar byed pa med do //
translated: But there is no one who makes them arise.🔽They arise naturally and spontaneously, and there is no one who makes them arise.

original: rang bzhin dang lhun gyis grub par 'jig par 'gyur yang de dag la 'jig par byed pa su yang med do zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po lugs su mthun par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rab tu rtog go //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang lhun gyis grub par 'jig par 'gyur yang de dag la 'jig par byed pa su yang med do zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po lugs su mthun par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rab tu rtog go //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva examines the forward progression of dependent origination.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: bden pa mngon par mi shes pa ni yang dag pa ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par mi shes pa ni yang dag pa ma rig pa ste /
translated: The non-understanding of the truths is the false view.

original: ma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: ma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The action done by ignorance is the formations.

original: 'du byed la gnas pa'i sems dang po ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la gnas pa'i sems dang po ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The first thought which is based on the formations is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The four aggregates which are appropriated simultaneously with consciousness are name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel pa ni drug gi skye mched do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel pa ni drug gi skye mched do //
translated: The development of name-and-form is the six sense-spheres.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni rig pa'o //
translated: The contact of the three, the sense-organ, the object, and the consciousness, which is accompanied by impurity, is contact.

original: reg pa'i rjes las skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i rjes las skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: That which arises after contact is feeling.

original: tshor ba la chags pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la chags pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: The attachment to feeling is craving.

original: sred par rnam par 'phel ba ni nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: sred par rnam par 'phel ba ni nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The development of craving is grasping.

original: nye bar len pa las byang ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa las byang ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: The action which is done by grasping and which is accompanied by impurity is becoming.

original: las dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: las dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skye ba'o //
translated: The effect which is similar to the cause is birth.

original: skye ba ni phung po 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni phung po 'byung ba'o //
translated: Birth is the appearance of the aggregates.

original: phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: The maturation of the aggregates is aging.

original: rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the aggregates is death.

original: 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tsho myos shing chags par 'gyur ba'i sems la yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tsho myos shing chags par 'gyur ba'i sems la yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: The mental anguish of one who is attached to and infatuated with what is dying and being separated from is sorrow.

original: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: The expression of sorrow in words is lamentation.

original: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The distress of the five senses is pain.

original: yid kyis lta ba'i nyams su bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyis lta ba'i nyams su bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The distress of the mind is grief.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste /
translated: The occurrence of many kinds of distress and grief is despair.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po dang / sdug bsngal gyi stong po 'ba' zhig byed pa po dang tshor ba po med par mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po dang / sdug bsngal gyi stong po 'ba' zhig byed pa po dang tshor ba po med par mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this mass of nothing but suffering, this great mass of suffering, is produced without any maker or feeler.

original: de 'di snyam du ste /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du ste /
translated: He thinks:

original: byed pa po la mngon par chags pas las rnams yod par gyur to //
analyzed: byed pa po la mngon par chags pas las rnams yod par gyur to //
translated: “Actions exist because of attachment to a maker.

original: gang na byed pa po med pa de ni don dam par na las kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang na byed pa po med pa de ni don dam par na las kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Where there is no agent, ultimately no action is observed.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks this:

original: 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag sems tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag sems tsam ste /
translated: “Thus, these three realms are mind only.

original: gang 'di srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: gang 'di srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go //
translated: All those twelve factors of dependent origination that the Tathāgata has distinguished and taught are present in a single mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po gang la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by desire for a thing is consciousness.

original: dngos @260b po ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: dngos @260b po ni 'du byed do //
translated: The thing is a formation.

original: 'du byed la mgo rmongs pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la mgo rmongs pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Delusion about the formation is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The mind that is born together with ignorance is name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs dang rnam par 'phel ba ni drug gi skye mched do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang rnam par 'phel ba ni drug gi skye mched do //
translated: The development of name-and-form is the six sense spheres.

original: drug gi skye mched dang 'brel pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: drug gi skye mched dang 'brel pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The connection of the six sense spheres is contact.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: What is born together with contact is feeling.

original: tshor bas mi ngoms pa de sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshor bas mi ngoms pa de sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the insatiable desire for feelings.

original: sred pas mnar te sdug cing mi gtong ba ni nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pas mnar te sdug cing mi gtong ba ni nye bar len pa'o //
translated: Clinging is the distress and the inability to let go of craving.

original: sred pa'i yan lag 'byung ba 'di dag ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i yan lag 'byung ba 'di dag ni srid pa'o //
translated: The arising of the craving link is becoming.

original: srid pa 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of becoming is birth.

original: skye ba yongs su smin pa ni rgya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su smin pa ni rgya ba'o //
translated: The ripening of birth is aging.

original: rgya ba dang bral ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rgya ba dang bral ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The separation of aging is death.

original: de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Ignorance is present in two activities.

original: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed do //
translated: It causes beings to be confused about their objects.

original: 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the formation of karma.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Karma formation is present in two activities.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin par yang mngon par grub par byed do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin par yang mngon par grub par byed do //
translated: It causes the formation of future results.

original: rnam par shes pa mngon par rgyu yang 'byin to /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon par rgyu yang 'byin to /
translated: It also produces the cause for consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Consciousness is present in two activities.

original: srid pa'i nying gi mtshams kyang sbyor ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i nying gi mtshams kyang sbyor ro //
translated: It also connects one to the next existence.

original: ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /🔽phan tshun nye bar ston pa yang byed do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te / phan tshun nye bar ston pa yang byed do //
translated: Name-and-form, in turn, is present in two activities:

original: skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also causes the six sense spheres to arise.

original: drug gi skye mched kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: drug gi skye mched kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: The six sense spheres are present in two activities:

original: rang gi yul rnam par phye ba ston to //
analyzed: rang gi yul rnam par phye ba ston to //
translated: They also reveal the differentiation of their own objects.

original: rig pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: rig pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: They also produce the cause for the actualization of contact.

original: reg pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: reg pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Contact is present in two activities:

original: dmigs pa la reg par yang byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa la reg par yang byed do //
translated: It also causes contact with the object.

original: tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin te //
analyzed: tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin te //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of feeling.

original: tsho ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: tsho ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Feeling is present in two activities:

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyis ka ma yin par tshor ba skyed do //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyis ka ma yin par tshor ba skyed do //
translated: It produces the feeling of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the origination of craving.

original: sred pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Craving is present in two activities:

original: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la mngon par chags par yang byed do //
analyzed: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la mngon par chags par yang byed do //
translated: it causes one to be attached to things that are desirable;

original: nye bar len pa'i mngon par 'grub ba'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i mngon par 'grub ba'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: it also produces the cause for the origination of grasping.

original: nye bar len pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Grasping is present in two activities:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas 'ching bar yang byed do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas 'ching bar yang byed do //
translated: it causes one to be bound by defilement;

original: srid pa mngon par 'byung ba'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: srid pa mngon par 'byung ba'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: it also produces the cause for the origination of becoming.

original: srid pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te //🔽srid pa'i rgyu gzhan du @261a * //
analyzed: srid pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te // srid pa'i rgyu gzhan du @261a * //
translated: Becoming is present in two activities:

original: yang gnas par byed do //
analyzed: yang gnas par byed do //
translated: it causes the cause of becoming to be transferred to another life;

original: skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: it also produces the cause for the origination of birth.

original: skye ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Birth is present in two activities:

original: phung po 'byung bar yang byed do //
analyzed: phung po 'byung bar yang byed do //
translated: it causes the aggregates to come into existence;

original: rga ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: rga ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: it also produces the cause for the origination of old age.🔽Old age is present in two activities:

original: rga ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rga ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Aging also has two functions:

original: dngos po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed do //🔽'chi bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed do // 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: it causes the transformation of entities;🔽and it causes the production of the causes of death.

original: 'chi ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Death also has two functions:

original: 'du byed 'jig par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed 'jig par yang byed do //
translated: it causes the destruction of conditioned entities;

original: yongs su ma shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: and it causes the production of the causes of the non-separation of ignorance.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //🔽'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o // 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: Regarding this topic, the statement “Conditioned by ignorance, the formations” means that conditioned by ignorance, the formations are not separated from one another and they are not interrupted.🔽The statement “Conditioned by the formations, consciousness” means that conditioned by the formations, consciousness is not separated from one another and it is not interrupted.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: The statement “Conditioned by consciousness, name and form” means that conditioned by consciousness, name and form are not separated from one another and they are not interrupted.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: The condition of name-and-form is the six sense spheres means that the six sense spheres are dependent on the condition of name-and-form.

original: drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o // reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is contact means that contact is dependent on the condition of the six sense spheres.🔽The condition of contact is feeling means that feeling is dependent on the condition of contact.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: The condition of feeling is craving means that craving is dependent on the condition of feeling.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa'o zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa'o zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: The condition of craving is grasping means that grasping is dependent on the condition of craving.

original: nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: “Conditioned by clinging is existence” means that existence is uninterrupted and continuous, conditioned by clinging.
