original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: “Conditioned by existence is birth” means that birth is uninterrupted and continuous, conditioned by existence.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi rgyun mi 'chad cing rton pa'o //
translated: “Conditioned by birth is old age and death” means that old age and death are uninterrupted and continuous, conditioned by birth.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag go zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen med pas 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi zhing rton pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag go zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen med pas 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi zhing rton pa med pa'o //
translated: “With the cessation of ignorance, the karmic formations cease” means that the karmic formations are pacified and cease to exist, since the condition of ignorance does not exist.

original: de bzhin du ji srid skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi 'gag go zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rkyen med pas skye ba nye bar zhi zhing rton pa med pa'o //

translated: Similarly, “conditioned by birth is old age and death” means that old age and death are pacified and cease to exist, since the condition of birth does not exist.

original: de ltar thabs dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis yan lag bcu gnyis can gyi srid pa'i @261b dngos po rnam par bsgom pa'i blo gros mnga' bas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis srid pa'i yan lag 'dzin par mdzad pas na /

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /

translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /

translated: the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena,

translated: the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of internal phenomena?

original: nang gi chos zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid de /
analyzed: nang gi chos zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid de /
translated: The so-called internal phenomena are the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de la mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir mig ni mig gis steng ngo //
analyzed: de la mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir mig ni mig gis steng ngo //
translated: The eye is empty of the eye because it is impermanent and subject to destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir rna ba dang / sna dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //

analyzed: 'dus ma byas de yang 'dus ma byas kyis stong pas de ltar na dngos po med pa dngos po med pas stong ngo //

analyzed: de la stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes pas ma byas mthong bas ma byas te /

analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /

translated: the reality of phenomena, the true nature of phenomena, the element of phenomena, the faultless nature of phenomena, thusness, unaltered thusness, the non-differentiation of thusness, and the limit of reality remain as thusness.

original: de ltar chos de dag gi stong pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya ste rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
